title: Culinary Administrative Assistant
company_info: The story of Bacha Coffee begins in the medina of Marrakech, Morocco. Built in 1910, the spectacular Dar el Bacha palace, which means “house of the Pasha”, united the greatest cultural and political minds of the century over glittering pots of “coffee of Arabia” or Arabica, as it is known today. Being the finest luxury coffee brand in the world, Bacha Coffee specialises in 100% Arabica coffees and provides customers with a unique opportunity to travel the world through their cup by exploring harvests from over 30 of the most well-reputed coffee producing countries. Even our distinctive fine blended, fine flavoured and naturally decaffeinated coffees are produced using only 100% Arabica beans to give coffee lovers the widest choice, without ever sacrificing quality or flavour.

Kopi & Tarts is expanding its outlets, a café concept selling local coffee and delectable pastries! Over here, we value the quality of our products, as well as service to our customers. Therefore, we are seeking suitable candidates to be part of our team in several of our outlets across Singapore.

*Preferred those who can start immediately.

Job description:-

Administrative
• Assist managers in supervising the operations of 1-2 outlets.
• Assist managers in staff planning, monthly stock taking and prepare monthly reports.
• Assist managers in conducting interviews with new candidates and report to HR Dept the necessary documentations.

Operations
• Attending to customers' ordering of food and beverages.
• Willing to leatn and acquire new skills in brewing of Kopis' and Tehs', according to the Company standards.
• SFA safety and hygiene standard and MUIS Halal training is a plus.
• Assist in daily operations of the store, ensure cleanliness at all times.
• Perform other duties as assigned by the management.• Comfortable in doing simple baking and light cooking at the premises.
• Willing to work shifts and weekends (according to the operational hours of the assigned outlets).

Requirements:-
• Interest in building a career in the Food and Beverage industry
• Self-driven and willing to learn
• Team player and confortable working with various teams
• Have a positive work attitude and motivated
• Good at interacting with customers and colleagues
• Must be willing to work on shifts, weekends and Public Holidays

Benefits:
• Annual Leave
• Shift Incentive
• Meal Allowance
• Medical Benefits
• Career advancement opportunities
• Staff uniform provided

How to apply:
If you think you have what it takes, email us at recruitment@mayson.com.sg.

company_info: SGS in Brief Wherever you are in the world, in whatever industry, you can rely on our international teams of experts to provide you with specialized business solutions to make your business faster, simpler and more efficient. We partner with you to offer independent services that will help you reduce risk, streamline your processes and operate in a more sustainable manner. You can find out more about how we can help you reach your objectives by viewing our corporate video. Our group profile SGS is the world’s leading inspection, verification, testing and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. With more than 80,000 employees, we operate a network of more than 1,650 offices and laboratories around the world. Our core services can be divided into four categories: Inspection: our comprehensive range of world-leading inspection and verification services, such as checking the condition and weight of traded goods at transshipment, help you to control quantity and quality, and meet all relevant regulatory requirements across different regions and markets Testing: our global network of testing facilities, staffed by knowledgeable and experienced personnel, enable you to reduce risks, shorten time to market and test the quality, safety and performance of your products against relevant health, safety and regulatory standards Certification: we enable you to demonstrate that your products, processes, systems or services are compliant with either national or international standards and regulations or customer defined standards, through certification Verification: we ensure that products and services comply with global standards and local regulations. Combining global coverage with local knowledge, unrivalled experience and expertise in virtually every industry, SGS covers the entire supply chain from raw materials to final consumption.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Office Administrator to join our team. As an Office Administrator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our office and supporting various administrative tasks. Your exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to handle multiple priorities will be key to success in this role.
Responsibilities:
Greet and assist customers and business partners, ensuring a warm and professional experience.
Manage incoming calls and correspondence, redirecting them as necessary.
Maintain office supplies and inventory, placing orders when needed.
Manage and maintain filing systems, both physical and digital, ensuring accuracy and accessibility of documents.
Requirements:
Familiarity with the motor trade industry is preferred, especially with loan applications handling and submission experience.
Proven experience as an Office Administrator, Administrative Assistant, or similar role.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in handling administrative duties.
Proficient in using office software, such as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and email/calendar management tools.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with a professional and courteous demeanor.
Ability to multitask and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to exercise discretion and confidentiality.
Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team.
High school diploma or equivalent; additional certification or training in office administration is a plus.
Additional Information
Career Level
Junior Executive
Qualification
Higher Secondary/Pre-U/'A' Level, Professional Certificate/NiTEC, Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma
Years of Experience
>1year
Job Type
Full-Time

Company Overview
MMM is a marketplace for astute car buyers and sellers. It is an e commerce platform that caters not only to automotive dealerships but also to the individual consumer. MMM connects buyers and sellers across B2B, B2C as well as C2C.
MMM provides users with a start to finish car buying experience. Dealers are able to showcase their stocks, auction their cars, trade with one another, and arrange car financing.
Consumers can choose the car they want, take out a loan, and purchase insurance to enhance buying experience.
The platform enables dealers and consumers to browse inventory, as well as apply for financing, anytime, anyplace and anywhere.
Until now, all these are dealt with by different portals. MMM brings all the separate elements into a complete car buying and financing ecosystem.

title: Office Admin cum Personal Assistant | Up to $4k / month – J.T.
company_info: BGC Group is an international recruitment and manpower outsourcing firm that identifies and delivers human capital solutions that imperative to every successful company’s growth. Having helped 25,000 individuals quickly land rewarding careers in companies that drive industries since our inception in 2005, we believe in developing relationships based on a solid ground of trust between both employers and job-seekers. This is what differentiates us and gives us a competitive edge from the rest. Staying true to our vision of Bridging & Growing Careers Because We Care, we are now proudly listed under Omnibridge Holdings on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (08462:HK) in 2017.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Seeking a highly organized and efficient individual to join our team as an Office Administrative Assistant cum Personal Assistant. This role will provide comprehensive administrative support to senior executives and ensure the smooth operation of daily business activities. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication and organizational skills, exceptional attention to detail, and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. The Personal Assistant / Administrative Assistant will be responsible for managing schedules, coordinating meetings, handling correspondence, and performing various administrative duties to contribute to the overall efficiency and productivity of the organization.

What you’ll be doing:
Manage and maintain executive schedules, including arranging appointments, meetings, and travel itineraries.
Act as a liaison between executives, employees, and external parties, relaying messages, instructions, and inquiries in a timely and professional manner.
Prepare and organize documents, reports, presentations, and correspondence, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Coordinate and schedule meetings, conferences, and events, including logistics, catering, and travel arrangements.
Maintain and update electronic and physical filing systems, ensuring efficient document management and retrieval.
Conduct research, compile data, and prepare reports and presentations for executive review.
Handle incoming and outgoing communications, including phone calls, emails, and mail, and prioritize and respond to them appropriately.
Assist with the preparation and editing of documents, contracts, and other business-related materials.
Manage and track expenses, process invoices, and maintain financial records.
Provide administrative support to various departments and teams, as needed.
Uphold a high level of confidentiality and discretion when handling sensitive information.
Perform general office duties, such as ordering office supplies, maintaining equipment, and coordinating maintenance and repairs.
Assist with special projects and other duties as assigned.
Able to travel on business trips.
Duties are mainly administrative and include maintaining personnel records, keeping confidential files.
What you’ll need:
High school diploma or equivalent; additional certification or education in office administration or related field is a plus.
At least 4 years of proven experience as a personal assistant, administrative assistant, or similar roles in hospitality.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with exceptional attention to detail.
Proficient in using office software applications, including word processing, spreadsheets, and presentation software.
Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and discretion.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Flexibility and adaptability to handle changing priorities and responsibilities.
Strong work ethic and a proactive approach to tasks.
Knowledge of general business practices and office procedures.
Familiarity with travel arrangements and expense management.
Ability to multitask and work well under pressure.
Benefits:
AL: 15-21 days (depending on seniority)
Performance bonus (2 months)
Interested applicants: kindly submit your resume to joelle.tam@bgc-group.com

title: ACCOUNTS CUM ADMIN ASSISTANT
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Admin / Secretarial, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:

The Accounting and administrative assistant performs a variety of general accounting and admin support tasks in an accounting department including:

Verifying the accuracy of invoices and other accounting documents or records.

Update and maintain accounting journals, ledgers and other records detailing financial business transactions (e.g., disbursements, expense vouchers, receipts, accounts payable). Enters data into computer system using defined computer programs (SAP).

Compile data and prepare a variety of reports.

Reconciles records with internal company employees and management, or external vendors or customers.

Recommends actions to resolve discrepancies.

Investigates questionable data.

Account and Admin Assistant Responsibilities:

Performing basic office tasks, including answering phones, responding to emails, processing mail, filing, etc.

Maintaining a database, ensuring that records are complete and current.

Recording information, processing, and filing forms.

Preparing checks, deposits, budgets, and financial reports.

Responding appropriately to vendor, client, and internal requests.

Ensuring Accounting Department runs smoothly and efficiently.

Qualifications:

Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook. Organizational, verbal and written communication skills a must.

Attention to detail and ability to multi-task is an asset.

Candiates holding Diploma and/or ITE can apply.

We are looking for an organized, efficient Accounting Clerk with an eye for detail and high level of accuracy. Accounting Clerks can expect to handle communications with vendors, clients, and internal departments, assist with inventory, database, and record maintenance, prepare financial reports, issue checks and making deposits, and generally ensure that the office operations are running smoothly. You should be professional and courteous with strong computer skills and a thorough understanding of accounting and financial principles.

To succeed as an Accounting Clerk, you should be a skilled multi-tasker with excellent time management, computer, and communication skills. Candidates should understand and abide by all accounting procedure and principles and have a commitment behaving ethically in the workplace.

title: HR Admin Assistant
company_info: We integrate research, strategy, design, engineering and operations to imagine, create and deliver some of the world's most engaging products and services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
HR Admin Assistant
At Aleph, we design human experiences by asking the right questions. Here, you’d find a curious breed of creative engineers spread across the globe, specializing in craft, strategy, and technology. With a keen ear to the ground, we turn big dreams into user-first digital solutions by design. Through rigorous prototyping, close collaboration, and responsive engineering, we commit to creating a future that leaves our craft, community, and clients better than before we began.

The Human Resources Administrative Assistant provides office support to the Human Resources department by maintaining personnel files, drafting correspondence and performing various other HR and administrative functions. You need to carry out all the HR and administrative functions as well as maintain the company’s culture. You will be responsible for making sure the processes and procedures are followed and well adhered to. Studio maintenance will be a crucial part of your job

Key Responsibilities

Operations
Office management of the Singapore studio.
Provide administrative support to HR team.
Manage travel bookings.
Manage office hardware and software.
Manage office administrative duties.
Maintain schedules and coordinate calendars of stakeholders.
Leave management:
Manage the leave process, which includes speaking to the employees, negotiating on the leaves and making sure there is only a certain headcount on leave in a week/month.
Liaise with the squad leads to get approvals.
Obtain the final approval from the clients.
Send daily reports of all people going on leave.
Maintain dashboards and reports.
Culture:
Support employee engagement and culture initiatives to create a positive and inclusive work environment.
Support and work with local leadership and regional leadership on delivering cultural initiatives.
Work closely with the operations team to ensure standards of procedures are followed closely.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the seamless planning and production of internal and external communications materials.
Prerequisites
Diploma or degree in human resources/administrative management.
Minimum 1 year of general administrative experience or a human resources background is preferred.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Outstanding time management and multitasking capabilities.
Strong ethics and reliable.
Cheerful and positive personality.
Someone who is able to provide solutions.
Benefits
Competitive salary (compensation will be based on experience).
Medical insurance.
Yearly reward based on performance.
Casual work environment and attire.
A solid team behind you: great people who love what they do.
A fun culture which promotes learning and knowledge sharing.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth offerings from our in-house Learning @ Aleph Academy, Flocket meetups, timely training for skills upgrade, workshops and conferences.
Plenty of snacks (healthy and indulgent), beverages.
Get in touch
Please visit www.aleph-labs.com or drop us an email at careers.sg@aleph-labs.com.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This advertisement is for recruiting for the position of Administrative Assistant.
If successfully selected, you will be seconded to a MOE Secondary School located in Lorong Napiri.
Contract Period : From 16 December 2023 to 15 December 2024.
Option to Extend : for a further period of twelve (12) months.
Personnel to be deployed at the following hours for :
Mondays to Thursdays : 8:00am to 5:30pm, inclusive of 1 hr lunch break
Fridays : 8:00am to 5:00pm, inclusive of 1 hr lunch break
Services not required on Saturdays, Sundays and gazetted public holidays.
The Services required are set out as follows:
To carry out heavy-duty printing services for all staff including printing/photocopy worksheets, circulars, notes and other materials required by the school staff for school/students’ use.
To assist the school General Office (GO) in reception counter duties and Information and Communications Technology (ICT) service desk on a daily basis, including attending to various requests from all walk-in, external and internal customers.
To assist the ICT Department in the management of IT equipment and supplies on an on-going basis.
To support GO in general duties such as paper and stationery supply, management, data management and data entry etc.
The Personnel shall have the following requirements:
Applicants should preferably have prior experience in printing and simple administrative duties.
Able to communicate and write in English
Minimum 3 years working experience in a similar capacity
Able to perform voluminous printing and photocopying work
Able to independently operate and adept with various office machines especially heavy duty copiers, risograph, collator, binding machine and laminating machine and can troubleshoot minor issues with office machines
A team player with a pleasant disposition and interpersonal skills
Meticulous and have an eye for detail

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
- Provide general administrative support, including answering phone calls, responding to emails, and handling correspondence.
- Manage calendars, schedule appointments, and coordinate meetings, conferences, and travel arrangements for team members.
- Prepare and maintain documents, reports, and presentations, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.
- Assist in the preparation of internal and external communications, including drafting emails, memos, and letters.
- Maintain and update filing systems, both electronic and physical, ensuring easy retrieval of information.
- Process and distribute incoming and outgoing mail, packages, and deliveries.
- Greet visitors, clients, and guests, and direct them to the appropriate person or department.
- Coordinate and organize office events, meetings, and conferences, including catering and equipment setup.
- Assist in budget tracking, expense management, and purchase order processing.
- Conduct research and compile data to support various projects and initiatives.
- Collaborate with other team members to ensure seamless workflow and efficient operations.
- Perform basic accounting tasks, such as processing invoices, managing petty cash, and reconciling expenses.
- Maintain inventory of office supplies and place orders as needed.
- Adhere to company policies and procedures, and maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.
Requirements:
- High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in office administration is a plus.
- No experience as an administrative assistant or in a similar role is welcome.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Strong organizational and time management abilities.
- Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
- Familiarity with office equipment and basic office management tasks.
- Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively.
- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.
- Discretion and ability to maintain confidentiality.
- Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
- Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines.
- Professional and positive attitude with a willingness to learn and grow.
If you are a motivated and proactive individual with excellent organizational and communication skills, we encourage you to apply for the position of Administrative Assistant. Join our team and contribute to our success by providing essential administrative support.

title: Assistant Manager, Certification & Customer Experience
company: INSTITUTE FOR HUMAN RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS LIMITED
company_info: The Institute for Human Resource Professionals (IHRP) is set up by the tripartite partners: the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) and Singapore National Employers Federation (SNEF) to professionalise and strengthen the HR practice in Singapore. IHRP implements a number of national human capital programmes, such as IHRP Certification, Skills Framework for HR and Human Capital Diagnostics Tool (HCDT). IHRP has the goal of setting the HR standards of excellence, developing HR as a strategic enabler of business and workforce transformation and fostering a vibrant HR services eco-system to drive innovation and change. Through the IHRP Certification and other national programmes, IHRP aims to enhance the competencies of HR professionals, as well as create developmental and professional pathways for them. This will professionalise and strengthen the HR practice in Singapore, allowing HR professionals to be key enablers in their organisations. IHRP partners with government agencies, tripartite organisations and the human capital development eco-system, including IHLs and private providers, to drive the adoption of progressive human capital practices in Singapore. IHRP is also the appointed program manager for the SkillsFuture Study Awards for HR and the National Young HR Talent Award.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are currently seeking a highly motivated individual for a 6-month contract position, which is intended to cover a maternity leave absence.

Location: Lifelong Learning Institute, 11 Eunos Road 8, Singapore 408601
Working hours: 8.30am to 6.00pm (Monday to Thursday), 8.30am to 5.30pm (Friday)

About:
The Certification & Customer Experience (CCE) team, which you will be a part of, oversees the end-to-end business operations for the national HR certification and IHRP’s knowledge partnerships with Institutes of Higher Learning, HR training providers and other industry bodies. These include initiatives aimed at strengthening the HR profession in Singapore through training and skills development.

Role Description
You will report to the Director of Certification & Customer Experience and ensure that certification products, grant administration and business operations for IHRP meet the organisation’s desired business outcomes and are consistent with quality standards for certification bodies.

The scope of your role will cover:

Support & Liaison for Certification and Grant Administration Matters
Act as the day‐to‐day liaison for certification matters for candidates and internal stakeholders
Act as the day‐to‐day liaison for grant administration matters for candidates and sector agencies
Manage the end‐to‐end assessment process ensuring a smooth assessment experience for candidates, and routinely conduct video audit of assessment
Manage the end‐to‐end business operations for certification and grant administration

Management of Database & Certification Systems
Maintain formal records of candidates and assessment outcomes on database
Gather and retrieve data from relevant systems
Generate certification‐related reports
Prepare and maintain dashboard on a weekly basis
Prepare quarterly reports and monitor grant utilisation on behalf of sector agencies
Lead audit preparations and independently drive process improvements
Manage CRM & certification system operations, provide day‐to‐day support and troubleshoot issues. This includes working with internal stakeholders to drive CRM and system enhancements

Customer Service
Act as a liaison between candidates and department to enhance the overall candidate experience
Uphold high customer service standards; ensure queries are answered in a timely manner and feedback are handled effectively

Admin Support
Work closely with the Certification & Customer Experience team to providegeneral team administration assistance as required

Requirements
Minimum 3 years of administration/business operations work experience
Motivated, diligent, and attention to details
Well-organised and able to multi-task
Able to work under pressure and in a fast-paced environment
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (vlookup, pivot table)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
URGENT

Location : Bukit Merah Central

Position : Digitisation Administrative Assistant

Working hours : 8.30 am – 530pm.

Contract period : Immediate (6months - 1 year)

Educational Requirements: Diploma / GCE ‘N’/’O’ Level qualifications. The salary range ($1,800 - $2,200 per month depending on qualification and relevant working expereiene) can only be determined once a selected candidate has been found. We compute based on competency.

Job scope :

Your duties and responsibilities include but are not restricted to the following:
• Organise HR documents (which consists of new hire’s contract, personal documents and recruitment forms) for scanning. This includes (1) labelling the documents, (2) packing and sorting the HR documents into boxes, (3) preparing and printing the Nominal Rolls before sending the documents for scanning. There are approximately 15 sets of documents for every new hire.
• Assist to oversee digitisation of HR documents. This will include liaising with the vendor on the scanning schedule and ensuring that all the physical documents are accounted for, delivered to as well as received by the vendor.
• Verify digitised HR documents. This will include tallying the scanned documents with the hardcopy documents to ensure that the scanned documents are complete and in order.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Administrative Officer
Our client, AMKFSC Community Services is a leading community-based social service agency, which provides a holistic range of services to support children, youths, families and seniors at multiple touchpoints across Singapore.
To provide timely administrative support to the department and division to facilitate operational efficiency and effectiveness for assigned administrative functions.
Roles and Responsibilities
Administration:
Update and maintain a comprehensive administrative filing system.
Provide customer services at the office front desk.
Provide administrative and logistic support for the departmental services & programmes.
Run official errands to bank, post office, office equipment supply store, other AMKFSC offices, and other organisations.
Undertake required office processes to ensure the timely repair and maintenance of office facilities and equipment.
Maintain the general tidiness and cleanliness of the office; overseeing housekeeping work done by hired/contract cleaner.
Organise annual emergency evacuation exercise e.g. Fire Drill exercise
Human Resource:
Update and store staff data (including personal and family details, leave, designations, telephone numbers, academic qualifications, and leave) in a timely and orderly manner.
Undertake staff training’s administrative work (including course registration, training grant application, tracking of training budget, etc.)
Update and maintain records of staff medical and dental claims.
Finance:
Collect fees and issue receipts for fees for programmes when needed.
Ensure that all financial claim forms and supporting documents are duly submitted by staff and are properly recorded and filed.
Safekeeping of monies (including petty cash, donations, programme fees etc) while pending deposit into agency’s designated account or submission to Finance Department.
Track usage and balance of funds allocated for centre’s programmes/events.
Collate staff claims (ie transport, staff wellness, ahoc-purchase) and submit it (with a list of claims) to Finance Department at stipulated interval (ie fortnightly/monthly).
Issue reimbursements to staff from petty cash (if applicable)
Assist Finance Department in all banking and financial matters when needed.
Other Responsibilities & Duties:
To provide constructive feedback in a timely manner on new work processes, forms and systems from Corporate Services Departments.
To implement the new work systems in accordance and in consultation with the relevant Corporate Services staff and department when requested
To undertake any other work responsibility assigned by supervisor/centre head
Desired Skills and Competencies
At least GEC ‘N’ Level.
Preferably with 2 years of work experience in office administration, human resource and/ or financial operations.
Able to work from Tuesdays to Saturdays, and ad-hoc weekday evenings.
Proficient in oral and written communication skills especially in English.
Meticulous and proficient in doing data-entry.
Good interpersonal skills and able to work in team.
Good organising and time management skills.
Take initiative to and appropriately contribute to the department, division and organisation.
Resourceful in getting and optimally using relevant resources to accomplish work targets cost-effectively and efficiently.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint and Excel).

company_info: FA SYSTEMS AUTOMATION (S) PTE LTD Established in 1988, FA Systems Automation (S) Pte Ltd ("FASA") is specialized in the design and manufacture of high-precision and high-speed automation equipment and solutions for different industries worldwide. With a proven track record of more than 28 years, FASA offers full turnkey manufacturing systems and solutions that are customized to meet customer’s specifications from conceptualization, design and development, precision assembly and integration, testing and commissioning.Through our strong Engineering and R & D commitment, we produce top quality products incorporating state-of-art technologies to meet our customers' stringent requirements. FASA customers include major global corporations and industry leaders in Electronics/Semiconductors; Computer/Printers; Automotive; PV Solar; and other industries. FASA provides a wide range of products for customers in these industries, including Assembly, Testing, and Packaging equipment, Laser marking/welding equipment, Vision Inspection equipment and many others. title: Assistant Director, Business Operations Management [R00014637]
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Future Ready Food Safety Hub (FRESH) serves as Singapore’s lead scientific platform under the Singapore Food Story R&D Programme, to bring together researchers, regulators and industry to build up Singapore’s food safety science and R&D capabilities to secure Singapore’s food supply and economic value proposition. FRESH will embark on R&D and talent development activities to help enhance Singapore’s local food regulatory capabilities. FRESH is part of the Singapore Food Story R&D Programme (SFS), with partner organisations being the Singapore Food Agency (SFA), A*STAR and the Nanyang Technological University (NTU).
As a key member of the FRESH core team, the Assistant Director will work with the FRESH Director to provide support the operations and administration.

Assistant Director (FRESH):

As a key member of the FRESH core team, the Assistant Director (FRESH) will be responsible for the following:
Key coordinator at FRESH for FRESH partnership between SFA, A*STAR and NTU.
Fully involved in supporting the operations and financial administration of FRESH.
Promote research capabilities to industry partners and explore potential collaborations.
Coordinate and host industry visits and meetings.
Build network and strengthen relationships with industry partners, including handling key collaboration portfolio with industry partners.
Prepare reports, monitor and follow up on industry engagements and trends.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Assistant Director (FRESH) should have the following qualifications:
Scientific degree and experience in business development would be an advantage
Good business acumen, resourceful and is a team player
Strong network and working knowledge of the Singapore research, regulatory and food industry environment.

title: Administrative Assistant
company_info: GREENMARK CONSTRUCTION PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description:

Scpoe:1

a. Clarification with Applicant and Relevant Parties:
Designated personnel will initiate direct communication with the applicant or relevant parties via phone or email.
The purpose of this communication is to request specific information, clarify existing data, or request missing documents.
Direct communication will enable efficient exchange of information and minimize delays.
b. Follow-up and Reminder Protocol:
A follow-up system will be implemented after the initial communication.
At least two follow-up reminders will be sent to the applicant or relevant parties in case of non-response or pending submission.
These reminders will serve to emphasize the importance of providing the necessary information or documents within the stipulated timeframe.
c. Supporting Document Submission Options:
Applicants have the option to submit supporting documents through two methods: email (scanned) or physical mail (hardcopy).
Scanned documents can be sent as email attachments to the provided email address.
Physical copies of documents can be mailed to the designated address.
Both submission methods are designed to accommodate different preferences and ensure accessibility.
This process aims to streamline the information and documentation gathering process, enhance communication with applicants and relevant parties, and maintain a systematic approach to address any discrepancies or missing information.

Scope 2:

Scenario: Application Verification, Routing, and Outcome Communication
Application Verification and Routing Preparation: a. For Hardcopy Applications:Designated personnel will handle hardcopy applications.
Data from submitted hardcopy applications will be entered and verified in the system. b. For Online Applications:
Personnel will verify the data of online application details in the system.
If no changes to the information are detected, the application will be verified and prepared for routing.
Routing to Approving Authority:Once verified, the application will be automatically routed by the authority's system to the relevant approving authority for decision-making.
This automated routing process ensures efficient and accurate forwarding of applications to the appropriate decision-makers.
Decision-Making and Outcome Determination:The approving authority will review the application and make a decision, which could be approval, rejection, withdrawal, or void.
The authority's decision is a crucial step that determines the outcome for each application.
Generation and Mailing of Outcome Letters:After the decision has been made, designated personnel will communicate the application outcome to each applicant.
Outcome letters will be generated using a standard letter template provided by the Authority.
Each outcome letter will consist of approximately four (4) A4 pages, one page per official language.
Pages bearing the authority's letterhead will be printed in color, while other pages may be printed in black and white.
All outcome letters will be mailed out using normal mail, unless alternative arrangements are agreed upon between the authority and the Contractor.
This process aims to ensure accurate verification of application details, streamline the routing of applications to decision-makers, and provide applicants with clear and standardized outcome communication.


Requirements:
Minimum Qualification in diploma or Equvalent
Microsoft Outlook: Proficient Level
Microsoft Excel: Intermediate Level (including VLOOKUP function, Pivot Tables, formulae) (as scope requires extensive use of Excel)

Our aim is to deliver high quality contamination-free cullet glass, raw material and by-products at a competitive price to our customers. title: Senior Assistant Manager, Administrative Support
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

title: Assistant Human Resources Manager - New Hotel Artyzen Singapore
company: SHUN TAK REAL ESTATE (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: OPENING IN MID-2023 A LUXURY VERTICAL OASIS IN THE HEART OF SINGAPORE Inspired by Singapore’s culture, colours, and flavours, Artyzen Singapore is a fresh interpretation of luxury. The site of this 142-room contemporary hotel was once named Villa Marie, the sprawling tropical-garden mansion of the grandson of Singapore philanthropist Tan Tock Seng. Embracing this unique heritage, Artyzen Hospitality Group worked in partnership with renowned architect ONG&ONG Pte Ltd and interior design studio Nic Graham & Assoc. to transform this lush property into a luxury vertical oasis in the heart of Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
· Pre-opening team
· Dynamic work environment
· Open and collaborative culture

Opening in 2023, Artyzen Singapore will be the first new hotel added to Singapore’s Orchard Road district in over a decade. What was once the sprawling home of the late Tan Hoon Siang (grandson of Singapore philanthropist Tan Tock Seng) is being transformed into a 20-story luxury property. The 142 rooms will sport a distinctive aesthetic, fusing reinterpreted facets of Peranakan art and style with contemporary design.

Responsibilities:
Recruitment and Selection: Assist in developing and implementing recruitment strategies and selection processes to attract and retain a highly skilled and diverse workforce. This may include conducting interviews, coordinating hiring efforts, and creating job postings.
Training and Development: Assist in developing and overseeing training programs to ensure that employees are adequately trained in their roles and can provide exceptional customer service to guests, as well as supporting their ongoing professional development needs.
Employee Relations: Assist in establishing and maintaining positive relationships with employees to promote a productive and harmonious work environment, and provide guidance and support on workplace conflicts and grievances.
Performance Management: Assist in developing and implementing performance management processes to monitor employee performance and provide feedback and support for improvement, including tracking KPIs and setting targets for improvement.
Compensation and Benefits: Assist in developing and managing compensation and benefit programs that are competitive, equitable, and consistent with the organization's goals and objectives.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws, regulations, and policies, and assist in developing and implementing internal policies and procedures to ensure compliance, including developing and implementing health and safety policies for hotel employees and guests.
HR Administration: Assist in the day-to-day administration of the HR department, including record-keeping, reporting, and communication, as well as managing HR-related software and technology platforms.
Strategic Planning: Assist in developing and implementing long-term strategic plans for the HR department that align with the organization's goals and objectives, including succession planning and talent management strategies.
Support other departments: Work with other departments within the hotel, such as housekeeping and food and beverage, to ensure that all employees receive necessary training and support.
Requirements:
Professional Certification in Human Resource Management, Business Administration or related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in HR management, preferably within the hospitality industry.
Strong knowledge of HR practices, policies, and regulations in the hospitality industry.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills, with a focus on guest service.
Demonstrated ability to manage and develop employees, including hiring, training, and mentoring.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on operational efficiency and cost savings.
Knowledge of HR software systems, such as payroll and scheduling software.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a focus on collaboration and open communication.
Strong organizational and project management skills, with an ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
Experience in change management and strategic planning is preferred.
Passionate and enthusiastic with a positive ‘can-do’ attitude

CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2019 revenues of $23.9 billion and more than 100,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included on the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #128 in 2020. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 19 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” for eight years in a row, including being ranked number one in the real estate sector in 2020, for the second consecutive year. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE.” CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. CBRE in Singapore Established in 1977 and having grown from a merger with CH Williams, today our Singapore business is comprised of more than 1250 professionals. Singapore also acts as headquarters for CBRE's strategic South East Asia regional hub. We believe in investing in people and infrastructure in order to strengthen our ability to offer the best to clients. company_info: Capital College of the Arts, Management and Technology (CCAMT) is Private Education Institute (PEI) with the Committee for Private Education (CPE) since 2013. CCAMT is a tertiary institute that is progressive and dynamic, whose student body is from China, South Korea, Taiwan, India, and South East Asian countries. We offer a wide spectrum of studies and practices within the arts and performing arts, alongside studies in management and technology. Within the College, there are five different Schools that offer contemporary practice together with the traditional and classical forms; they are Faculty of Contemporary Arts and Design, Faculty of Entertainment Arts, Faculty of Management and Technology, Faculty of Music, and School of Continuing Education. ABOUT CAPITAL COLLEGE
Capital College represents an innovative and dynamic tertiary institution, drawing in students from regions like China, South Korea, Taiwan, India, and Southeast Asia. company_info: As a global professional services recruitment consultancy, Morgan McKinley connects specialist talent with leading employers across multiple industries and disciplines. In Singapore we specialise in Banking & Financial Services, Legal, Compliance & Audit, Finance & Accounting, IT, Project Management, Sales & Marketing, HR and Supply Chain & Procurement.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Morgan McKinley is seeking a Senior Executive Administrative Assistant for a 12-month contract highly renewable.

As a Senior Executive Assistant, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the seamless operation of the executive team. You will be responsible for managing complex calendars, coordinating travel arrangements, and overseeing expense reports. Your ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and prioritize tasks efficiently will be key to your success in this role.

Key Responsibilities:
Calendar Management: Efficiently schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and events for executives, utilizing time management skills to optimize their daily schedules.
Travel Coordination: Arrange domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, and ground transportation, ensuring a smooth and stress-free travel experience.
Expense Management: Process and reconcile expense reports, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies.
Communication: Act as a primary point of contact for executives, screen and prioritize emails and calls, and handle correspondence with professionalism.
Documentation: Prepare and maintain important documents, reports, and presentations.
Meeting Support: Provide logistical support for meetings, including preparing agendas, taking minutes, and ensuring follow-up on action items.
Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments and team members to facilitate cross-functional projects and initiatives.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience preferred.
Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role supporting senior executives.
Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in calendar management, travel coordination, and expense reporting.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
Interested candidates may apply through the application system or send it to sg-techcontracting@morganmckinley.com. Shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A. Overall Purpose of The Job

Key role in support of the TRICARE Overseas Program (TOP) administration of healthcare support services globally. Multifunctional position driving administrative coordination and delivery of core service elements enabling the wider team performance and customer satisfaction.


B. Key Responsibilities

· Coordination of the medical records collection processes to facilitate the collection, translation and delivery of medical records to stakeholders
· Process any other TOP related administrative activities as per given instructions to ensure timely and accurate resolution
· Deliver medical service administrative activities supporting TOP beneficiary healthcare support services
· Maintains confidentiality of all beneficiary information
· Understand and carry out all processes, policies and procedures pertaining to the duties of a TOP Administrator
· Maintain all documentation in accordance with company policies and procedures. Respond to in-bound inquiries promptly and ensure complete resolution
· Send written communication to follow up with beneficiaries and providers, when appropriate
· To work with the wider Intl.SOS teams to ensure TRICARE processes, self-service tools and benefits rules are understood and communicated accurately to beneficiaries and providers
· Actively promote electronic submission and payment solutions and other self-servicing products
· Maintain specific quality and quantity standards, including service level key performance indicators
· Always adhere to company policies and procedures
· If requested, assist with the training and mentoring of new staff
· Attends and participates in International SOS staff meetings and educational offerings


C. Job Profile

Required Skills and Knowledge
· Empathic written skills
· Ability to use positive language
· Ability to create relationships and work within a globally distributed team
· Good understanding of processes and systems
· Good understanding of cultural nuances and how to be successful in a multicultural environment

Required Competencies
· Team player and ability to achieve targets
· Organized with the ability to effectively manage own time
· Demonstrate problem solving skills
· Demonstrate clear communication skills when resolving issues
· Customer Service Oriented
· Process Focused – drives for results

Required Work Experience
· Experience in a related environment (i.e. office, administrative, clerical, customer service, etc.) using computers as the primary job tools
· 2-3 years customer service year experience, (email, web based or physical correspondence)
· Experience working/processing in a healthcare environment an advantage

Required Qualifications
· High school diploma/Upper Secondary (or higher) OR equivalent work experience
· Proficiency with computer and Windows PC applications, which includes the ability to learn new and complex computer system applications

title: Legal Administrator
company_info: IRD Global is an international not-for-profit organization based in Singapore, with IRD country affiliates registered in Bangladesh, Indonesia, Nigeria, Pakistan, Philippines, South Africa, Vietnam, and Zimbabwe. We leverage process and technology innovations to develop, implement, and scale cost-effective, evidence-based, and high-impact solutions to stubborn health challenges. Our teams have pioneered open source information technology innovations in mass health screening and immunization registration mobile health applications, interactive SMS systems, digital conditional cash incentives for patients, caregivers and health workers, electronic medical records, and civil registration and vital statistics systems for low resource environments. Our strengths lie in our passion for improving the lives of the most vulnerable and underserved populations and our belonging to the countries where we work, as well as in our wide range of technical expertise, our organizational culture, shared values, close-knit working relationships, and our leadership on multiple global policy and technical committees. We are committed to innovation, evidence-based interventions, and local capacity building. We have the ability to both pivot and thrive in the face of changing circumstances and new opportunities and are strategic risk-takers. Being one of only a handful of large health research and service delivery organizations originating from, and led by, the Global South, we are particularly well positioned to develop context-specific solutions to public health problems.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose of the Job:
As a Legal Administrator, you will be responsible for contributing to the smooth functioning of the Legal Department at IRD by managing administrative tasks, facilitating communication, and supporting the legal team.
Job Responsibilities:
Organize, maintain, and manage legal documents, contracts, corporate records, and correspondence.
Ensure proper document indexing, filing, and retrieval in the required contract management system or cloud storage.
Coordinate and manage legal professionals; calendars, including scheduling meetings and appointments.
Help prevent scheduling conflicts and ensure timely adherence to legal obligations. Schedule and coordinate legal department meetings, conferences, and training sessions
Facilitate communication within the legal department and with external parties, including clients, vendors, and other departments.
Organize, maintain, and manage legal documents, contracts, corporate records, and correspondence and other corporate governance activities. Maintain accurate records of corporate actions and resolutions.
Maintain up-to-date and organized records of legal matters, expenses, billing, corporate actions, resolutions and timekeeping. Review and process legal billing statements and invoices. Coordinate billing activities with the finance department.
Assist with contract management processes, including tracking contract renewals, amendments, and compliance. Coordinate document execution and filing.
Provide administrative assistance to legal staff. Provide support by preparing legal documents, presentations, reports, and other materials as needed.
Assist legal professionals with legal research tasks, including gathering information on relevant laws, regulations, and industry practices. Compile research findings for analysis
Proficiently use legal software, document management systems, and research tools to enhance efficiency and streamline processes. Stay informed about legal industry trends, updates, and best practices. Seek opportunities for professional development to enhance job skills.
Assist with special projects, initiatives, and cross-functional collaborations that require legal department involvement.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s Certificate in Law or related (desirable).
2 to 3 years as a paralegal/ in a law firm/ or in-house legal department(corporate/company) to do either legal administrative work or legal secretarial work.
Analyzing information, identifying relevant details, and conducting thorough research on legal matters to assist lawyers and paralegals effectively.
Able to interpret and comprehend legal documents such as contracts, court filings, and other legal materials.
Proficiency with databases and tracking systems to track deadlines, and access relevant legal resources efficiently.
Organized and detail-oriented is essential for accurately managing documents, schedules, and various administrative tasks in a fast-paced legal environment.
Must remain composed under pressure and consistently meet deadlines to support the work of the legal team.
Working independently on tasks and collaborating effectively within a team to achieve common goals.
Effective communication is key when interacting with stakeholders.
Being adept in software such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) is essential for drafting documents and managing office tasks. Familiarity with legal-specific software like Plexus and scheduling software enhances efficiency in legal operations.

title: Personal Assistant
company_info: Who We Are Westport Partners is a privately owned boutique firm that specializes in enhancing our Corporate Client’s top talent and the Careers of entrepreneurs and professionals wishing to take their business and vocation to the next level. We help support our client’s businesses and careers by partnering with you to help develop significant opportunities throughout the core periods of your business growth and career be it a major acquisition, internal promotion or the consideration of an external move. Our business philosophy is driven by partnering with outstanding people who we believe can achieve exceptional results. Westport Partners is uniquely positioned as a hybrid human resource consultancy –delivering strategic expertise and human capital solutions that benefits of both our corporate and personal clientele. What We Offer Career Optimization: We provide bespoke solutions and strategic career guidance to entrepreneurs and professionals looking to take their business and careers to the optimal levels. We are career architects. Business Optimization: For our corporate clients wishing to develop their key talent, we provide a bespoke and strategic solution that further enhances your business offering and bottom-line delivery. We do this by adhering to a business philosophy that focuses on what you need, not just what we offer. Our access to captains of industry and an efficient decision-making process, enables us to move quickly when supporting our client’s growth or when you are streamlining the business. The team has over 75 years of combined human capital, recruitment and management advisory experience in various sectors, with a proven track record of successful, industry-leading business and career enhancement.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Advertising / Media, Human Resources
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Westport Partners is a Human Resources Consultancy that specialises in Talent Optimisation. We are looking for a highly energetic individual to join us to support the Group Managing Director.

Role: Personal Assistant
Reporting to the Group Managing Director, you will be responsible for organising and coordinating office operations and procedures in order to ensure organisational effectiveness and efficiency.

You will be the Personal Assistant of the Managing Director as well as responsible for supporting the day-to-day needs of the Singapore and Hong Kong offices and it’s staff. You will ensure that all related operational, administrative, and logistical requirements are met.

Scope:
Finance
- responsible for payroll (including CPF), GST, management expenses
- handling online banking transactions
- liaising with the firm's accountants
- we will help train you in these areas
Office & Admin
- responsible for the upkeep of the entire office
- maintain office supplies (e.g. stationery, corporate gifts, pantry items, etc)
- coordinate & organise meetings & corporate events
- maintain office filing system
- record office expenditure and manage the budget
- ensure office policies, operating standards & procedures are in place and adhered to
- manage the reception (e.g. answer phone calls, receive guests, arrange meetings, etc)
- respond to customer enquiries and complaints
HR administration
- update of policies, procedures & programmes
- maintenance of personal files & staff welfare
- overseeing the recruitment of new staff, sometimes including training and induction
- handle payroll, staff leave, renewals of insurance policies, staff claims
IT administration
- assists in IT requirements (e.g. virus scan for server, set up new workstation & troubleshooting, etc)
- maintain OA / IT equipment & supplies
- manage IT service providers (e.g. internet, telephony, etc)
- manage projects as assigned (e.g. database management systems, etc)
Others
- assist in ad-hoc assignments when required (e.g. report preparation, business case presentation, marketing activities, etc)

The Successful Applicant
To be successful, ideally you will be a recent graduate or have at least 2 years of experience in administration or office management. You are independent, have attention to detail and a sense of initiative. You are enthusiastic and possess a “can do” attitude. Excellent organisational, communication, interpersonal, problem solving and decision making abilities are a must.

You will be part of a dynamic team, as such we are looking for a driven and dynamic individual who likes to work in a fast-paced environment.

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
company_info: Established in 2013, IPrint Express Pte Ltd is your best choice to Express and Quality printing services in Singapore. We are a team of dedicated professionals with years of trusted experience in printing on many different medias and formats to suit a variety of personal and corporate projects. Our E-commerce website was established in 2015 and it was one of the first few E-commerce websites in Singapore that offered customers a convenient means to place their print orders online and arrange for a self-collection or delivery. We are proud of our achievement in being able to easily reach out to the locals in Singapore and provide them with all their printing needs. Likewise, we are also able to extend beyond our borders to overseas customers from regional countries such as Hong Kong, Japan and even in international regions like Europe, Australia and more. Customers that travelled to Singapore for events or functions could utilize our indispensable platform to place their orders online. The items can then be confirmed and arranged to be printed, delivered and ready at the hotel in time for their events. This was an invaluable and one-of-a-kind service at the time and remains so to this day. However, we did not stop there and we are constantly seeking ways to evolve and improve our printing services. We use the latest in high production range machines to produce high quality printing with metallic gold and silver ink. We pride ourselves in offering an array of finishing options such as lamination, customizable die-cut, booklet binding and more. We have also expanded to include ourselves as providers of Display Stands and Installation services. Gradually adding on Personalized printing services, such as direct mailing and variable data printing, where we can print addresses or customize greetings to your prints and facilitate postage to target residential or business areas. We also include Brand design in our repertoire of services where we help customers reshape or recreate logos to get them started in building the foundation of their personal or corporate brand and identity. In year 2021, our new website has been redesigned to a more versatile, powerful and modern format. It remains at its core, a convenient and accessible platform to upload your files, place your orders or request for quotations efficiently. Information on the materials, products, finishing, guidelines and many more services that we offer are now made readily available and presented in a concise manner. This has been done to assist all our customers in getting the right information they need to make the right purchase for your projects. Our goals has always been to be able to provide all customers with Express, Convenient and Quality printing services. We are passionate about providing you a hassle-free experience from ordering to printing. We are located in the heart of the East and if you have any questions, simply let us know and we can be of assistance.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Admin / Secretarial, Advertising / Media
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Administration Assistant to join our team. As an Administration Assistant, you will be responsible for handling various administrative and clerical tasks to support the smooth operation of our organization. Your primary responsibilities will include preparing and sending out invoices, settling accounts with customers and vendors, maintaining invoice and bill files, tracking spending, creating regular spending and sales reports, and performing data entry tasks. The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Responsibilities:
Prepare and send out invoices to customers accurately and in a timely manner.
Settle accounts with customers and vendors, ensuring payments are made or received promptly.
Maintain organized files of invoices, bills, and other financial documents.
Keep track of spending and maintain accurate records of expenses.
Generate regular spending and sales reports for management review.
Perform data entry tasks, including entering financial data, customer information, and other relevant data into the system.
Assist with general administrative tasks such as filing, photocopying, and scanning documents.
Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence, including mail and emails.
Collaborate with other team members to ensure efficient workflow and provide support as needed.
Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and adhere to data protection policies.
Qualifications:
High school diploma or equivalent; additional certification or training in office administration is a plus.
Proven experience as an administration clerk or similar role.
Strong proficiency in using office software such as MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Attention to detail and accuracy in handling financial and administrative tasks.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.
Basic knowledge of accounting principles and practices.
Experience with data entry and maintaining databases or information systems is preferred.

company_info: Mingfa traces its origins to a small pushcart in the alleyways of Chinatown, where Lim Chye Kang sold his handmade fishballs with noodles to a small but loyal customer base in 1946. The business was passed down from father to son twice, and more than 70 years on, the third generation has overseen an expansion of the family business - from a single pushcart in the ‘40s to thirteen outlets islandwide, as well as franchises in Jakarta. title: Administrative Assistant
company_info: WARDE TEC TAIWAN was established in year 2003 for Semiconductor market in Taiwan and WARDE TECHNOLOGY (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. was setup in year 2012 to support the Semiconductor customers in South Asia regions. WARDE TEC Taiwan headquarter and factory is located in Hsinchu City, Taiwan (R.O.C.) near the major Semiconductor Industrial Park. Our Company manufacture parts for both 200mm and 300mm Semiconductor Fabrication Plants and have been supporting to Semiconductor companies in Singapore, Malaysia, USA, Taiwan, China, Europe and Japan for more than 10 years. Our main products are CMP Polishing and Cleaner parts such as Membranes, Head Rebuilt parts, consumable parts and machine equipment parts. Over the past 10 years, we have built confidence with our customers in terms of consumable parts, especially for High Performance Plastics and Rubber products in terms of quality and competitive pricing. We have also move from supporting CMP modules to other areas, such as CVD (NOVELLUS), PVD, Etch and Implantation for other parts overhaul services and consumable parts.
address: AMK TECH II, 5 ANG MO KIO INDUSTRIAL PARK 2A 567760
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
WARDE TECHNOLOGY (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. was setup in year 2012 and WARDE TEC TAIWAN was established in year 2003 for Semiconductor market in Taiwan to support the Semiconductor customers in South Asia regions. WARDE TEC Taiwan headquarter and factory is located in Hsinchu City, Taiwan (R.O.C) near the major Semiconductor Industrial Park.

Our Company manufacture parts for both 200mm and 300mm Semiconductor Fabrication Plants and have been supporting to Semiconductor companies in Singapore, Malaysia, USA, Taiwan, China, Europe and Japan for more than 10 years. Our main products are CMP Polishing and Cleaner parts such as Membranes, Head Rebuilt parts, consumable parts and machine equipment parts.

Over the past 10 years, we have built confidence with our customers in terms of consumable parts, especially for High Performance Plastics and Rubber products in terms of quality and competitive pricing. We have also move from supporting CMP modules to other areas, such as CVD (NOVELLUS), PVD, Etch and Implantation for other parts overhaul services and consumable parts.

Key Responsibilities:
Provide general administrative support, including managing phone calls, emails, and correspondence.
Assist in organizing and scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for staff members.
Maintain and update company records, databases, and filing systems, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality of information.
Prepare and distribute documents, reports, and presentations as required by the team or management.
Assist in coordinating internal and external communications, including drafting and editing correspondence and documents.
Monitor and maintain office supplies inventory, placing orders when necessary to ensure availability.
Assist in managing office facilities and equipment, ensuring they are in good working condition.
Support financial administration tasks, such as processing invoices, expense claims, and purchase orders.
Assist in maintaining and updating company policies and procedures, ensuring compliance across the organization.
Handle ad-hoc administrative tasks and projects as assigned.

Qualifications and Skills:
Minimum Professional Certification, Higher NITEC or Diploma in Business Administration, Office Administration, or a related field.
Proven experience as an administrative assistant or in a similar role, preferably within the semiconductor industry or related field.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other relevant software applications.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry, record-keeping, and document preparation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with stakeholders at all levels.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a proactive and resourceful mindset.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment.
Bilingual in both spoken and written Chinese and English - to liaise with Chinese speaking associates.
Positive attitude, strong work ethic, and willingness to learn and grow within the role.

title: Trust Administration Assistant
company_info: Kensington Trust Group (KTG) established a presence in Singapore in 2013. In the same year it formed a strategic alliance with JTC, which was further strengthened the following year with JTC’s investment. This association creates a global offering of trust, fiduciary, corporate and fund administration services to what is now the collective JTC Kensington client base. In August 2016, Kensington Trust Singapore Limited was granted a licence by the Monetary Authority of Singapore to conduct trust business, offering specialised jurisdiction-specific fiduciary solutions. Overview To ensure a corporation thrives, we believe you need expertise not just in the day to day operations but also behind the scenes. Just like a skilled and dedicated landscape artist who can create an amazing sculptured garden, JTC Kensington has the know-how to nurture your corporate or fiduciary interests, ensuring a corporation or an entrepreneurial enterprise thrives. With a hand-picked team of experienced professionals in the trust and fiduciary business, JTC Kensington can help you manage and administer cross border business activities; set up and administer private trusts; and provide corporate management and administrative services. This leaves you and your management team free to concentrate on what you do best while we support you with how, where and when. Our Mission JTC Kensington aims to live up to its well-known namesake in the United Kingdom with its intricate formal gardens, squares, palaces and museums. Not just in its physical features but also in our depth of knowledge and understanding of the trust and fiduciary business. Given the collective experience of our team, we have in-depth knowledge of structures and we work with advisors in the implementation of these structures. We understand the role of proper management as a pillar in sustaining long term relationships with clients. In this context, our operating philosophy centres on our commitment, hard work and dedication rather than number of clients or assets under administration. In brief, our mission will be driven by a single-minded passion – 'Our Hands at Work' – and the proof will be seen in how we deliver on our projects. Our Vision We aim to be the preferred Trust Group with expertise and knowledge in understanding and fulfilling Clients needs; We nurture a culture deriving satisfaction from growing our Business and recognizing & rewarding our Employees. Our Business Principles We put our Clients First We value our Employees We enhance our Shareholders' value Our Services We help our clients achieve the success their business deserves. We take care of all their business corporate needs through our complete suite of Accounting, Payroll, and Corporate Secretarial services that covers all aspects of setup and ongoing company administration, and Trust and Trustee Services. Visit our website at https://www.kensington-trust.com/our-services/ktg-services/
address: FAR EAST FINANCE BUILDING, 14 ROBINSON ROAD 048545
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Banking and Finance, Professional Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The role is for KENSINGTON TRUST SINGAPORE LIMITED PTE. LTD.
Roles & Responsibilities
At Kensington Group, you will have the opportunity to build a career as unique as you are, with the support, inclusive culture, and technology. Your unique perspective and voice will help you and your team become even better. Come join our team and create an exceptional experience for yourself as well as a better working environment for everyone.
Your next opportunity
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Trust Administration Assistant to join our dynamic Trust Administration team. The Trust Administration Assistant will play a vital role in supporting the efficient and effective trust administration of trust accounts and work closely with and assist the Trust Administrator(s) in ensuring all the data of the clients, the trust structure and its assets are properly recorded and maintained.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate closely with the Trust Administration team to obtain information to complete required forms and documentation accurately, ensuring smooth workflow and timely completion of tasks.
File and scan correspondence, documents, and any other information related to the trust structures, ensuring proper organization and confidentiality.
Fill up bank forms and assist in preparing necessary documentation related to trust structures and banking transactions.
Assist in storing scanned documents to ViewPoint, our entity administration software, to maintain comprehensive electronic records.
Provide general day-to-day administrative support to the Trust Administrator(s), helping them manage their workload effectively.
Perform other related duties as assigned.
Qualifications Requirements:
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
Meticulous attention to detail, accuracy, and strong organizational skills.
Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work effectively.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, etc.).
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, regulatory and deadline-driven environment.
High level of integrity, professionalism, and ethical conduct.
What We Offer:
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, a collaborative work environment, and opportunities for growth and development.
To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your experience and qualifications.
