description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Since October 2011, Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.
THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for the elderly and the sick, families, persons with disabilities, and children.  We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.
Together, as ONETHK – Empowering the Community.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Early Intervention Programme for Infants & Children (EIPIC) division helps equip children with motor, communication, social, self-help and cognitive skills. THK Development Support and Learning Support Programme (THK DS-LS) is a community-based intervention programme for K1 and K2 children with mild learning needs. We provide short-term support to children in their preschools in order to optimise their learning as well as increase their participation and integration in daily classroom activities and routines.
Reports to the Senior Social Worker, and/or DS-LS Programme Manager.
Responsibilities:
Work onsite to perform administrative duties such as answering phone calls, mailing and filing of documents, collection of school fees and weekly bank-ins
Participate in Case Filter Meetings, take notes and maintain good record keeping
Assist with scheduling of cases for professionals who are working with child
Maintain accurate records, prepare reports for governing agencies, collate information and submit government means-test applications
Follow up with parents, hospitals and preschools on necessary documents for submission. This may include travelling to different preschools in the Central and Central-South region of Singapore
Assist with audit preparations such as checking of files
Ad-hoc duties as assigned by supervisor
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimally O levels, with extensive years of working experience / A Levels
1 to 3 years of experience working in SSAs preferred, fresh graduates may apply
Proficient in MS Office Applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
Team player, meticulous and have good administrative skills
Able to work independently
Able to meet deadlines on a tight schedule
Have some understanding of the diverse cultures and races
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Contracts Administrator
1. General Duties & Responsibilities
• Responsible for administration of contracts management, purchasing, tendering, Company's performance evaluation and other documents (physical and electronic)

2. Administration
• Assist Manager & QS in performance of responsibilities
• Maintain standardized forms, proposals (hard & soft copies)
• Develop & maintain filling system
• Maintain and update insurance for projects
• Schedule courier for outgoing document and collections of incoming
• Update and upkeep projects detail (ongoing and completed projects) for presentation purposes
• Assist to fulfil requirements of Company's quality standards pertaining to tender and contract administration
• Compile data as and when required for Director's / Contracts Manager's utilisation
• Update and upkeep project, tender and common files (ie Completion Certificate, Contract Document, Insurance, Defects Liability Period, Warranties, etc)
• Send and collect BCA upgrading form to Client for assessment
• Qualification of new sub-contractors / vendors and update Approved SubContractors' / Vendors' List

3. Contracts Management • Maintain contract documents
• Maintain and update project's and tender's drawings
• Arrange for sub-contractors' sign off of letters of award, progress payments and final accounts
• Coordinate with Site QSes for sub-contractors' recommendations/payments
• Receive and update drawings list (tender, addendum, contract, issued / approved for construction)

4. Tendering
• Review, prepare and distribute pre-tender pre-qualification requirements
• Maintain Tender Register and assign project reference number to new tenders
• Set up files and folders in contracts server for new tenders
• Assign numbers to all incoming bid docs

• Maintain tender files until turnover to project team

• Provide sub-contractors with sufficient document and information for their quotations

5. Purchasing • Stand-in for Procurement Officer during her absence
• Verify all invoices and purchase orders on behalf of QSes
• Assist Purchasing Department where so required

6. Additional Duties
• Recommend cost reduction policies in regard to contract administration
• Suggest productive measures
• Additional duties as arranged

title: Receptionist / Admin Assistant
company_info: Since its inception in 2004, Educare Human Capital (EHC) Private Limited has been providing Human Resource (HR) solutions to the schools, as well as Government and private organisations, especially within the Education industry. It all started from the proposal in August 2004 by the Singapore Teachers’ Union (STU) to Ministry of Education of Singapore (MOE) to ease the workload of teachers so that they can focus on teaching, when Educare Human Capital (EHC) Private Limited piloted and implemented the Teacher Assistant Scheme. The scheme aimed to elevate teaching and teachers’ lives through the recruitment and management of TAs, as they assist the teachers administratively and operationally. The success of the scheme has since made EHC one of the most credible education manpower service providers amongst others, where it has been trusted with staffing within the realms of administration, ICT, laboratories, sports coaching and even management of the schools. Today, EHC serves more than 200 Singapore schools, presenting itself as one of the principal Education Human Resource solutions providers in Singapore. Beyond the schools, EHC has made its foray into other government sectors, and had clinched multiple contracts to provide manpower services for the government ministries and organisations, such as the Ministry of Home Affairs (Commercial Affairs Department), Ministry of Health, Ministry of Finance (VITAL), The State Courts, Singapore Workforce Development Agency and Energy Market Authority. EHC has also explored business opportunities to the private sector within the education realm. EHC has deployed staff to international schools and institutions, which include ISS International School, Hollandse School Singapore, Tien Hsia Language Centre and others. Over the past 3 years, EHC’s total headcount within the government organisations (Non-MOE) and private sector grew by more than 300%, representing its broadening market presence. Even as EHC continues to diversify its business, it never strays away from its founding philosophy and philanthropy. EHC has been and always will be striving to maintain at least 60% of its services to the schools in Singapore, so as to give back to schools and communities, where it shapes destinies through job creation, resolving unemployment and off-loading admin duties of teachers.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:
The School's Receptionist and Administrative Assistant is responsible for managing the front desk, providing administrative support, and ensuring effective communication within the school. They play a crucial role in maintaining a welcoming and organized environment.

Key Responsibilities:
Front Desk Management:
Greet and welcome visitors, parents, students, and staff in a professional and friendly manner.
Answer phone calls, take messages, and direct inquiries to the appropriate staff members.
Manage and maintain the school's main email account.
Administrative Support:
Assist with administrative tasks such as filing, data entry, photocopying, and document preparation.
Maintain and update student records, attendance records, and other school documents.
Help organize and distribute incoming and outgoing mail and packages.
Student & Parent Interaction:
Provide information to parents and students regarding school policies, procedures, and events.
Handle inquiries and concerns from parents and students, directing them to the appropriate staff members.
Supplies & Inventory:
Monitor and order office supplies and equipment as needed.
Keep inventory of school supplies and materials.
Communications:
Maintain clear and effective communication with school staff, parents, and students.
Prepare and distribute newsletters, announcements, and other communication materials as directed.
Record Keeping:
Keep confidential information secure and follow privacy regulations.
Qualifications Required:
O Levels or equivilant
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in computer applications such as word processing, spreadsheets, and email.
Organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize responsibilities.
Discretion and the ability to maintain confidentiality.
Previous experience in an administrative or receptionist role, preferably in an educational setting, is often preferred but not always required.

title: Assistant Early Years Educator
company_info: Oaks Plus Limited (hereafter known as “OPL”) is a Company Limited by Guarantee (CLG) with Charity status that is committed to assisting underprivileged kids and their families. As one of the appointed operators under ECDA's Partner Operator Scheme, we believe that every child should have equal access to opportunities in learning and education and reach their maximum potential in life regardless of their socioeconomic status. OPL has experience in serving Singapore’s multi-racial community. Presently, OPL owns and operates 7oaks Preschool centres, offering affordable and quality early childhood offerings that encompass a robust curriculum, highly qualified educators and centre leaders, and standards in line with the SPARK accreditation. OPL has in place an experienced management committee comprising of the Board of Directors and the preschool management team who brings together a myriad of experience and expertise in the day-to-day running of the company and the curation of OPL early childhood strategies. OPL also works closely with regulatory agencies such as ECDA and MSF to ensure compliance with legal and licensing regulations of its preschool centres.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objectives
The main responsibility is to support class teachers in the care and development of children at the child development centres. He or She assists teachers when conducting lessons and other classroom activities. The assistant teacher assists to coach individual children who may be physically or educationally chanllenged; and work with small groups of children, with the teacher's direction.
Responsibilities
1) Child Development
Applies child development knowledge to promote and support children's learning and holistic development specific to individual needs.
2) Learning Environments and Curriculum
Assists teacher in preparing and presenting lessons plans materials or programmes to children in a one-to-one or group setting
Assists in monitoring and supervising the children in the classroom, on field trips, mealtimes and other activities
Assists in monitoring the class when teacher is occupied
Assists children in routine and transition
3) Family Engagement
Ability to interact and speak effectively with peers, children and parents in an open friendly business-like manner.
4) Administration
Assists to make quick, responsible decisions regarding children's welfare and safety, including counseling them regarding conduct and self-discipline
Provide administrative support for class recordkeeping and updating portfolio and communication book as required
Ability to read and understand documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence
Any other duties that may be assigned from time to time
Requirements
Para-educarers are required to undergo the Fundamentals in Early Childhood Care and Education Course. They can acquire the training within one year of joining the service.
Para-educators are required to have a minimum training requirement of the Certificate in Early Childhood Care and Education (CECCE)
Has a valid first aid certificate recognized by ECDA
Has good communication skills
Has effective instructional skills in meeting each child's learning style
Has nurturing disposition with patience and passion in working with young children

title: Accounts and Office Administrator
company_info: No information added.
address: UNI-TECH CENTRE, 55 TOH GUAN ROAD EAST 608601
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview: We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented General Accounts and Office Administrator to join our team. As the General Accounts and Office Administrator, you will be responsible for managing various administrative tasks, maintaining financial records, and providing support to ensure smooth office operations. Your role will encompass a combination of accounting, bookkeeping, and administrative duties.
Responsibilities:
Accounts Payable and Receivable: Manage accounts payable and receivable processes, including processing invoices, reconciling payments, and following up on outstanding balances. Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records.
Bookkeeping: Perform general bookkeeping tasks, such as recording financial transactions, managing petty cash, and reconciling bank statements. Prepare and maintain financial reports, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.
Payroll Administration: Assist in processing payroll, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and relevant regulations. Maintain employee records, including attendance, leave, and benefit information.
Office Administration: Handle various administrative tasks to support the smooth operation of the office. This may include managing office supplies, coordinating meetings, handling correspondence, and maintaining filing systems.
Reception and Communication: Serve as the first point of contact for visitors and incoming calls. Provide assistance, direct inquiries to the appropriate departments, and ensure a professional and welcoming office environment.
Data Entry and Database Management: Accurately enter data into relevant systems and databases. Maintain and update customer, vendor, and employee records as required.
Correspondence and Documentation: Prepare and edit documents, correspondence, and reports as needed. Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information and ensure proper handling of confidential documents.
Vendor Management: Assist with vendor management, including maintaining vendor records, processing vendor invoices, and managing vendor relationships.
Compliance and Record Keeping: Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and internal policies. Maintain proper documentation and records, including financial, administrative, and HR-related files.
Ad hoc Tasks: Support other departments and team members with ad hoc administrative tasks and projects as needed.

Qualifications:
Diploma or equivalent work experience. Additional certifications or courses in accounting or office administration are a plus.
Proven experience in a similar role, performing accounting and office administration tasks.
Strong knowledge of basic accounting principles and procedures.
Proficiency in accounting software and MS Office suite (Excel, Word, Outlook).
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record keeping.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with colleagues at all levels.
Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Familiarity with relevant regulations and compliance requirements.
If you are a reliable and proactive professional with a strong background in accounts and office administration, we encourage you to apply for the position of General Accounts and Office Administrator.

Stolt-Nielsen Gas (SNG) entered the market for the transportation of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) in late 2009, building on the company’s global expertise in the safe and efficient transportation of cargoes with specialised handling requirements. Stolt Bitumen Services (SBS) focuses on the high quality, safe and reliable distribution of bitumen using modern bitumen tankers, bitutainers and storage terminals in Asia Pacific. title: LEARNING FACILITATOR / ASSISTANT LEARNING FACILITATOR, SPECIAL EDUCATION
company_info: In 1992, Rainbow Centre Singapore was established as a registered charity with the Registry of Societies and subsequently, it was granted the Institutions of a Public Character (IPC) status under the Charities Act. The Centre runs 3 Special Education (SPED) schools and 2 Early Intervention Programme (EIP) centres at Margaret Drive campus and Yishun Park Campus for children with special needs. All the Centre's programmes adopt a holistic developmental curriculum in the areas of language and communication skills, cognitive skills, social and emotional skills, fine and gross motor skills, and adaptive daily living skills. They are carried out by a multi-disciplinary team of trained SPED and EIP Teachers, Speech Language Therapists, Physiotherapists, Occupational Therapists, Psychologists, Social Workers, and Music and Art Therapists.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Rainbow Centre envisions a world where persons with disabilities live Good Lives – lives that are empowered and thriving.

Our special schools at Rainbow Centre aim to enable students with disabilities to develop to their fullest potential so that they can achieve their highest level of independence and lead thriving lives.

Reporting to the Senior Teacher (ST) and working under the guidance of the Teacher(s), the Assistant Learning Facilitator supports the Teachers to provide quality learning experiences for students and support the best deliverance of the curriculum.

Those with experience will be appointed as Learning Facilitators.

Critical Work Functions:
1. Support Curriculum & Instructional Excellence
Co-plan lessons with teachers by participating in discussions and contributing ideas and suggestions for lessons and behaviour support and carry out learning activities
Assist teachers to prepare the learning environments, including preparing materials and resources for teaching and learning
Work with teachers to maintain the classroom environment, facilities and other resources for maximum engagement of students in their learning
Assist students, individually or in groups, during lesson delivery and help to present or reinforce learning concepts in accordance to lesson planning
Assist with the health, medical, safety and daily living needs of the students

2. Support Holistic Student Development
Provide physically, emotionally and socially-safe relationships and environments to enhance motivation and behaviour, and opportunities for learning
Build a strong relationship with students by exhibiting care, concern and encouragement
Assist teachers in observing students to collect data for monitoring individualised learning objectives and student progress in learning and behaviour outcomes
Under teacher supervision, carry out behavioural intervention plans and support in managing student behaviours

3. Support Programme Administration
Assist Teacher in maintaining inventories of equipment, materials and supplies

4. Collaborate for Optimal Student Learning and Development
Work in partnership with allied professionals and appropriate other internal stakeholders for effective planning and execution of development strategies for the student
Participate in various organisational and school initiatives and/or events

5. Develop Self for Greater Impact
Review and reflect on teaching work so as to seek improvement in professional competencies
Support Curriculum & Instructional Excellence

title: Assistant Manager (Administration and Operations), Antai Asia-Pacific Center
company_info: About Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU) SJTU, as one of the higher education institutions in China which enjoys a long history and world-renowned reputation, is a key university directly under the administration of the Ministry of Education (MOE) of the People's Republic of China and co-constructed by MOE and Shanghai Municipal Government. Through some 120 years' unremitting efforts, SJTU has become a comprehensive, research-oriented, and internationalized top university in China. About SJTU Asia-Pacific Graduate Institute (SJTU-APGI) SJTU-APGI positions itself as an extension of SJTU’s education and research efforts, as well as a platform for overseas resource integration and internationalization. In the long run, SJTU-APGI aims to become a world-class overseas educational institution recognized not only in Singapore, but also internationally. About Antai Asia-Pacific Center (AAPC) AAPC is an oversea branch of Shanghai Jiao Tong University's (SJTU) Antai College of Economics and Management (ACEM), which is set up within SJTU Asia Pacific Graduate Institute (SJTU-APGI). ACEM has a long history which can be traced back to the Business School of Nan Yang Public School founded in 1903. ACEM offers a variety of distinctive programs, including Graduate: PhD; MBA; Executive MBA; Executive Education; Master of Finance; Master of International Business; and Undergraduate: BS in Finance; BS in Economics; BBA in Management. The school has a strong focus on the financial market and economy in China as well as international business, in collaboration with distinguished schools of business in Europe, Asia and U.S. Email: apgi@sjtu.edu.cn Tel.: (+65) 6601 4038 Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sjtuapgi LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/school/sjtu-apgi

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Title: Assistant Manager
Location: Antai Asia-Pacific Center (AAPC), SJTU Asia-Pacific Graduate Institute

Role Overview:
We invite applications for the role of Assistant Manager at the Antai Asia-Pacific Center. This essential role is responsible for the day-to-day management of the office, student services, and front desk operations. The Assistant Manager will play a crucial part in ensuring a smooth and efficient working environment, contributing to the overall success of the institution.

Responsibilities:
Serve as the primary contact for office, student, and guest inquiries, ensuring a high-quality experience for all stakeholders.
Oversee daily office management, including supply procurement, facility maintenance, and financial administration such as budgeting and reimbursements.
Manage logistical and administrative support, including calendar scheduling, meeting preparation, and travel arrangements.
Coordinate student services, from academic support to guidance, enhancing the educational experience.
Contribute to policy development and implementation, focusing on secretarial standards and operational best practices.
Assist in the preparation and distribution of various business and internal communications, including reports, presentations, and meeting agendas.
Maintain data integrity through meticulous record-keeping and database management.

Requirements:
A minimum of a bachelor's degree is required.
A minimum of 5-10 years of experience in office administration, student services, or a related field.
Exceptional organizational, analytical, and time-management skills.
Fluent in both English and Chinese, with superior verbal and written communication abilities.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
Flexibility to work outside standard business hours, including weekends, as required.
Candidates with Singaporean Citizenship is preferred.
Service Improvement:
Work proactively to implement process and policy improvements, leading to increased levels of customer service.

If you are a dynamic, analytical, and resourceful professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply. Join our team at the Antai Asia-Pacific Center and make a difference in the world of graduate education!

Within the St Luke’s eco-system, St Luke’s ElderCare delivers a full range of integrated services and programmes for our elders through our Residential Facility in Ang Mo Kio, Active Ageing Hub in Bishan, Active Ageing Centre (Care) in Chong Pang and 24 Senior Care and Rehabilitation Centres islandwide, while St Luke’s Hospital is a 243-bed community hospital that serves patients regardless of race, language or religion. Delivering a full range of integrated services and programmes for our elders including maintenance day care, day rehabilitation programmes such as physiotherapy and occupational therapy, dementia care, nursing care, respite care, wellness programmes and transportation, the services also designed to benefit elders who have suffered physical disabilities as a result of stroke, falls or accidents, as well as the frail and lonely who have no one to look after them during working hours.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As an Administrative Assistant (RAU), you will be responsible for delivering quality frontline customer service, and administrative and operational support to the manager and HOD in ensuring efficient and smooth operations for Home Based Services. You will also be tasked to create a positive experience for all internal and external customers and clients to ensure quality client care experience and satisfaction.

Responsibilities:
· Understand and fulfil SLEC’s mission and strategy.
· Manage Client referral and registration process.
· Schedule and reschedule appointments.
· Monitors appointment bookings to ensure efficient visit scheduling which enables maximal utilization of professional staff and resources.
· Provide financial counselling about services and necessary support for the applications or renewal of various applicable financial schemes (e.g., NMTS, Financial Assistance).
· Cashiering duties and managing outstanding account follow-ups.
· Reconcile monetary transactions.
· Attend and manage feedback and enquiries about service.
· Handle complaints and feedback and perform service recovery.
· Liaise with internal and external stakeholders for the provision or continuation of service. (i.e., Coordination with service partners, Lab dispatches)
· Assist in reporting and analysing service statistics and data.
· Provide administrative assistance to the department or service. (i.e., Data entry, verification, claims submission, licensing renewal, reports, raising procurement requests, etc).
· Assist in identifying problem areas and participate in quality improvement initiatives and projects.
· Anticipate and resolve problems during daily operations.
· Provide appropriate feedback to Manager.
· Ensure policies are adhered to by Clients and caregivers.
· Any other projects that are assigned by the manager.

Job Requirements:
· Minimum GCE “N, O, A” level or Diploma.
· At least 2 years of working experience in customer service or health care services.
· Customer service oriented with good frontline, communication, and interpersonal skills.
· Effective written and oral communication skills.
· Ability to speak different local languages and dialects will be advantageous
· Resourceful and proactive.
· Meticulous in handling administrative tasks.
· Strong team player with strong communication, interpersonal and organisational abilities.
· Capable of working independently and under time constraints.
· Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Founded in Singapore in 2004, Akribis Systems is a motion control company that provides high precision direct drive motors. We construct products for a range of industries including renewable energy, semiconductor, communication, biomedical, robotics or any industry that requires precise motion.
We produce direct drive motors with a high force density and patented coil design that decreases cogging. Our linear and rotary motors also are available with stages that we manufacture ourselves so you can smoothly integrate the motor into your design.
More than simply a manufacturer, we are also innovators. Our deep knowledge of engineering and dedication to the work has resulted in 44 patents, and our research and development into the field of magnetics will only continue to grow our business. Our engineers are able to custom design motors and stages to your specific requirements with you as a co-developer.
Today, we have two production factories and numerous sales and support offices across the globe. At Akribis Systems, precision matters.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Since October 2011, Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.
THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for the elderly and the sick, families, persons with disabilities, and children.  We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.
Together, as ONE THKMC – Empowering the Community.
RESPONSIBILITIES
The Administrative Assistant at Children Therapy Centre (CTC) plays an essential role to support the therapists (PTs, OTs, SLTs,), provide administrative and customer service to the clients.
 The Administrative Assistant works collaboratively in a team that consists of Allied Health Professionals (AHPs), administrative, accounts and other staff from Therapy Services. S/he also performs various administrative tasks and participates in projects specific to the work setting.
  Duties and Responsibilities
The Administrative Assistant is expected to be able to:
Manage enquiries on CTC services via calls, texts and emails
Direct enquiries to the relevant personnel
Provide information regarding the CTC services to incoming inquiries
Provide high quality customer service to internal and external clients
Greet persons entering organization
Conduct hygiene and screening checks based on infection control and Safe Management guidelines
Provide general administrative and clerical support
Collect, record payment from clients and sure proper book-keeping of receipts, payment vouchers
Coordinate with clients’ parents/caregivers/partners to organise appointments
Maintain attendance of clients either manually or electronically
Tidy and maintain the reception area, therapy spaces, gyms and conference rooms
Attend centre meetings
Monitor cleaning and stationery inventories
Assist to acquire quotations and raise purchase requisitions
Undertake any other tasks assigned by the Centre Manager
  Professional Development and Conduct
Participate in continuous professional development training workshops e.g., Microsoft Office, customer service, service recovery, communication skills
Adhere to workplace health and safety standards
Monitor individual key performance indicators
QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum ‘O’ levels
Good verbal and written communication skills
Good organisational and time management skills
Excellent interpersonal skills, customer orientated attitude with a professional presentation
Basic competency in information management systems using Microsoft Office and customer relationship management software
Pleasant telephone, message and email etiquette
Preferably with client-facing experience

title: HR and Administrative assistant
company_info: JCS ECHIGO (JE), a manufacturing company established in 1999, specialising in the provision of ultrasonic and various cleaning equipments, cleanroom products and manufacturing services to world-wide clients. Our company strives to deliver high quality products and excellent technical services to all our clients. History JCS was established in Singapore in 1990 to provide automation services for the electronics industry. Over the years, we diversified to serve a wide range of industries, including the Hard Disk Drive, Semiconductor, and Automotive industries. Today, we have found our niche in the manufacture and supply of precision cleaning machines and services focused specifically towards the Hard Disk Drive industry. Product & Services Despite our strengths in this field, establishing a foothold in the market proved a challenge as companies dealt with established and recognized players. Our breakthrough came with a contract from Fujitsu. When news spread of our superior service levels and technology, our reputation as a leading supplier of precision cleaning machinery and solutions became firmly established. The JCS sales arm was set up in 1999 to streamline our precision machinery and sub-assembly services, and ultrasonic and cleaning equipment. By 2003, our Clean Room Cleaning and Assemblies services was in such demand that it was set up as a stand alone service provider. From 2004 onwards, JCS was further established within the aerospace and medical device industries. Through various partnerships and technological development, we made significant inroads into these industries, which traditionally have high barriers of entry. JCS maintains a strong presence regionally. Today, we have an extensive international network; with a sales and technical support office in Thailand, manufacturing and sales offices in China, sales network in South East Asia and the United States, providing easy access to our customers the world over.

title: PreSchool Administrator cum Assistant Teacher
company: MINDCHAMPS PRESCHOOL @ WEST COAST PLAZA PTE. LIMITED
company_info: MINDCHAMPS PRESCHOOL @ WEST COAST PLAZA PTE. LIMITED
address: WEST COAST PLAZA, 154 WEST COAST ROAD 127371
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Understand the required centre operations and support P / VP / AVP/ LT / ST / ET in centre’s operations
Job Responsibilities:
CURRICULUM
Ø Maintains a safe and hygiene environment for children
Ø Identify the importance of routine activities and transitions.
Ø Recognises routine care as important learning experiences.
Ø Follows daily schedule and understand the predictability for young children.
Ø Responding to children’s initiations and requests, including nonverbal cues.
Ø Uses care-giving activities such as diapering and dressing, as an opportunity to foster healthy development through positive adult/child interactions.
Ø Recognise the importance of sensory experiences, exploration and play in children’s growth and learning.
Ø Participates in children’s play without taking over the activity.
Ø Demonstrate basic concepts of observation.
Identify nonverbal cues, gestures, and moods through observation.
CONNECTING WITH FAMILIES
Ø Identify and use appropriate communication skills to communicate positively and in a manner that respects the diversity of families.
CENTRE OPERATIONS
Ø Follow basic conflict-resolution strategies during interactions with colleagues and parents.
Ø Oblige the vision, mission and core values of the centre.
Ø Know and follow all programme policies and procedures.
Participate in maintaining the environment to support children’s safety andlearning.
HEALTH AND SAFETY
Ø Ensure Champs safety in all areas and activities. Eg: Champs are to be supervised at all times.
Ø Ensure all Champs’ hygiene at all times. Eg: Proper hand washing and food handling habits.
Ø Assist class teachers in maintenance of classroom to adhere to safety and hygiene regulations. Eg: refilling hygiene items like tissue and sanitiser and regular toy washing.
Ø Report any damage/safety hazards in classroom to class teachers
Ø To ensure cleanliness in all parts of the centre
Ø To be fully prepared for supporting class teachers during any fire evacuation exercise.
Ø Staff are patient with messiness slow eater are given time to finish food, children are encouraged to eat independently.
Ø Staff and children observe good hygiene practices.
Ø Wash hands after toileting, before/after meals and after outdoor and art activities.
Ø Proper sanitary procedures are observed during diaper changing
Ø Staff wash hands before/after diaper changing.
Ø Soiled diapers are disposed in a covered bin.
Ø Children are supervised at all times,
Ø Children are within sight, hearing and easy reach of staff Eg: Staff quickly get materials from cupboard in room)
Ø Staff’s attention is on care giving responsibilities, not on other tasks or interests.
Ø Power points are out of children’s reach or rendered harmless.
Ø There are proper storage facilities for play equipment; more than 2 staffs are present during outdoor play.
Ø Safety gates are latched at all times
Job Requirements:
Ø Diploma
Ø Creative and inspiring with loving energy
Ø Excellent communication and classroom management skills
Ø Be familiar with all working curriculum documents, handbooks and policy manuals.
Ø Knowledge in educational development

title: Assistant Manager, Administration & Operations
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
The Nanyang Business School invites applications for the position of Assistant Manager, Administration & Operations.
The Assistant Manager is required to support the Manager to ensure effective and efficient running of all administrative aspects of the China Programmes. Specifically, the Assistant Manager will take charge of the daily operation of two Programmes: MSc (Finance) and NTU-PKU Double Masters, and the logistics of the MSc (Finance) Student Industry Field Trips.
Responsibilities:
Programme Operation
To assist in the planning of timetable and teaching appointment
To update and maintain student records and assist in course registration.
To manage the examination and related matters
To offer good support for course instructors and make sure of smooth delivery of lessons.
To manage the teaching evaluation process and work with the Accreditation Office on China Programmes’ accreditation review.
To assist in the collation of statistics and data required for different surveys and reports.
To take charge of the overall logistics of the Student Industry Field Trips
To assist in the execution of events and activities such as student orientation, seminars, farewell dinners, and etc.
To assist in finance related matters such as procurement of course materials.
Student Support and Candidature Management
To handle student enquiries in a timely manner.
To handle requests pertaining to leave of absence, withdrawals, deferment, extension of candidature etc.
To monitor student’s graduating status and schedule related activities
Requirements:
A degree holder, preferably with relevant work experience of 3 to 5 years.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially Word, Powerpoint and Excel.
Meticulous with a keen eye for details and a good team player.
Quality and customer-service oriented.
Good interpersonal communication and organizational skills.
Effectively bilingual (reading, writing, and speaking) in English and Chinese due to the need to liaise with Chinese speaking students and foreign stakeholders based in China for the education programmes.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Title: Administrative Assistant - Floral Services

Job Summary:
As an Administrative Assistant in this floral industry, you will play a crucial role in ensuring efficient operations and exceptional customer service. Your responsibilities will include processing online orders, coordinating with logistics partners, managing billing processes, providing flower business expertise, preparing gifts and messages, and maintaining a tidy work environment. Additionally, you will be responsible for delivering outstanding customer support through various communication channels.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Online Order Processing: Receive and process online orders for floral arrangements, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
2. Logistics Coordination: Coordinate with logistics partners to schedule flower deliveries, track shipments, and address any delivery issues promptly.
3. Billing and Records: Accurately input and maintain billing information into systems, ensuring invoices are sent to customers in a timely manner.
4. Flower Business Knowledge: Develop a deep understanding of the flower industry, including flower types, seasonal availability, and popular arrangements.
5. Gift Preparation: Assemble and prepare gifts, including gift wrapping, card writing, and ensuring personalized messages are included.
6. Customer Service: Respond to customer inquiries via WhatsApp, email, chat, and phone, addressing questions about order processing, delivery status, and resolving issues with professionalism and courtesy.
7. Ad-Hoc Support: Assist in various ad-hoc tasks and projects as needed to support the smooth operation of the floral business.
8. Tidiness: Maintain a tidy and organized work area, ensuring the cleanliness and presentation of the workspace.

Qualifications and Skills:
- Polytechnic diploma / JC or equivalent; additional education in administration or business is a plus.
- Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
- Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
- Proficiency in using Shopify and Aspire for order processing and record-keeping.
- Customer-focused with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
- Knowledge or interest in the floral industry is advantageous.
- Ability to work efficiently under pressure and meet deadlines.
- Flexibility to adapt to a dynamic work environment.

Working Conditions:
This role is based in an office / flower shop environment. It involves occasional weekend or public holiday work to accommodate customer demands. You will use various communication tools (Whatsapp, Email, Chatbot, Calls) to interact with customers and suppliers, ensuring smooth order processing and excellent customer service. Maintaining cleanliness and order in the workspace is essential for a productive and pleasant work environment.

title: Assistant Manager, Administration and Outreach
company_info: GLOBAL SEARCH PARTNERS PTE. LTD. Global Search Partners is a reputable recruitment services firm focused on mid-to-senior and specialist level appointments. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to Head, ICT Academy, the incumbent shall be responsible for outreach and administrative matters, ranging from organising meetings, reporting preparation, to company engagement.


This role is offered on a 3-year fixed term contract basis, subject to satisfactory performance. Salary range around $4000.


Remuneration is based on a 12-month salary structure, with annual variable bonus which is subject to the incumbent’s performance and the University/School’s prevailing remuneration policies.


Key Duties and Responsibilities:

Outreach Activities
• Initiate and conduct outreach activities, as well as manage both the relationship and implementation of organisations’ manpower re-deployment plans ; organisations include MNCs, Large Local Enterprises (LLEs), SMEs, members of Trade Associations & Chambers (TACs) and Unions.
• Grow a strong network of organisations as key employers and industry partners.


Partnership
• Collaborate with relevant partners and government agencies to actively promote career opportunities and help PMETs in identifying personal goals, re-skilling and career planning.
• Collaborate with the various Institutions of Higher Learning, Training Providers and Academic Units in providing suitable courses for the placement-oriented programmes, seeking government funding support and engaging in employer outreach activities, based on strategic priorities.


Publicity
• Work with the Marketing team in creating marketing materials and tools to conduct outreach activities.
• Market and generate awareness of programmes and placement-oriented programmes to both organisations and individuals.
• Assist to promote re-employment programmes (e.g. CCP, SCTP) to organisations such as MNCs, Large Local Enterprises (LLEs), SMEs, members of Trade Associations & Chambers (TACs) and Unions.


Administration
• Assist in secretariat functions of ICT Academy
• Generate and prepare reports for updates and decision-making
• Coordinate all administrative matters for the ICT Academy
• Liaise with HR, Finance and other corporate services representatives
• Maintain and upkeep databases related to the Academy
• Compile and analyse statistics for submission to Government agencies


Requirements:
Academic & Professional Certification
• At least a good bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a reputable university
• IT savvy and proficient in MS Office and Adobe applications
• Knowledge of Power BI would be an added advantage


Experience & Attributes
• At least 3 years’ relevant work experience in providing office administration and secretariat support
• People-oriented with strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
• Meticulous, self-driven, able to work independently and as a team
• Able to multi-task and manage requests effectively


(EA Licence No. 14C7000)
(EA Personnel Registration No : R1110355)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
1. Attachment Description:
This position reports to the Account Supervisor. Need to support accounting department with data entry, processing, and recording transactions, updating the ledger, assisting with audits, budgets and reports. The primary work focus is on accounts receivable and accounts payable. In addition, they help with issuing invoices, collections, billing, filing and journal entries.

2. Role & Responsibilities:
a. Providing support to the Accounting Department.
b. Performing basic office tasks, such as filing, data entry, handling daily emails, processing the mail, etc.
c. Handling inventory & Assisting in stocktaking.
d. Processing transactions, registration, tenders, and updating ledgers, budgets, etc.
e. Assisting with audits, fact checks, and resolving discrepancies.

3. Competencies :
a. Active participation in strategic planning process, including developing goals, objectives and processes
b. How to engage employees and stakeholders professionally
c. Gain experience with AutoCount Accounting Software and database management and record keeping
d. How to be a skilled multi-tasker with excellent time management, computer, and communication skills.
e. Gain knowledge with basic Accounting principles.

4. Education Qualifications Required for the Traineeship Role:
a. at least Diploma/Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma in any field.
b. Familiar with MS Excel and basic Accounting knowledge
c. Good math skills and the ability to spot numerical errors
d. Positive attitude, meticulous and someone with initiative
e. Hardworking and fast learner

title: Administrative Assistant (Property Management)
company_info: About CBRE With broader and deeper capabilities than any other company, CBRE is the leading full-service real estate services and investment organization in the world. CBRE Group, Inc. is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with 2019 revenues of $23.9 billion and more than 100,000 employees (excluding affiliate offices). CBRE has been included on the Fortune 500 since 2008, ranking #128 in 2020. It also has been voted the industry’s top brand by the Lipsey Company for 19 consecutive years, and has been named one of Fortune’s “Most Admired Companies” for eight years in a row, including being ranked number one in the real estate sector in 2020, for the second consecutive year. Its shares trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol “CBRE.” CBRE offers a broad range of integrated services, including facilities, transaction and project management; property management; investment management; appraisal and valuation; property leasing; strategic consulting; property sales; mortgage services and development services. CBRE in Singapore Established in 1977 and having grown from a merger with CH Williams, today our Singapore business is comprised of more than 1250 professionals. Singapore also acts as headquarters for CBRE's strategic South East Asia regional hub. We believe in investing in people and infrastructure in order to strengthen our ability to offer the best to clients. Our local market knowledge and extensive business offering keep us ahead of the competition. Consequently, we are widely regarded as the leading market leader in terms of commercial leasing, investment sales, residential project marketing and commercial asset management in Singapore.

title: Assistant Manager, Administration and Placement Programmes
company_info: GLOBAL SEARCH PARTNERS PTE. LTD. Global Search Partners is a reputable recruitment services firm focused on mid-to-senior and specialist level appointments. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to Head, ICT Academy, the incumbent shall be responsible for outreach and administrative matters, ranging from organising meetings, reporting preparation, placement programme administration to company engagement.


This role is offered on a 3-year fixed term contract basis, subject to satisfactory performance.


Remuneration is based on a 12-month salary structure, with annual variable bonus which is subject to the incumbent’s performance and the School’s prevailing remuneration policies.

Salary range up to $4000.


Key Duties and Responsibilities:

Outreach Activities
• Assist in outreach activities and manage both the relationship and implementation of organisations’ manpower re-deployment plans; organisations include MNCs, Large Local Enterprises (LLEs), SMEs, members of Trade Associations & Chambers (TACs) and Unions.
• Grow a strong network of organisations as key employers and industry partners.


Partnership
• Collaborate with relevant partners and government agencies to actively promote career opportunities and help PMETs in identifying personal goals, re-skilling and career planning.
• Collaborate with the various Institutions of Higher Learning, Training Providers and Academic Units in providing suitable courses for the placement programmes, seeking government funding support and engaging in employer outreach activities for placement programmes.


Placement Administration
• Pursue job placement targets and ensure rapid, sustainable growth in all identified industry segments.


Publicity
• Work with the Marketing team in creating marketing materials and tools to support new placement programmes.
• Market and generate awareness of placement programmes to both organisations and individuals.


Project Management
• Assist in managing Placement Programmes, such as Career Conversion Programmes (CCP) or similar type of initiatives, including project strategy design, outreach activities, stakeholder management, programme structures, systems development and project operations.
• Assist in driving implementation of organisations’ manpower re-deployment plans ; organisations include MNCs, Large Local Enterprises (LLEs), SMEs, members of Trade Associations & Chambers (TACs) and Unions.
• Conduct on-board activities for organisations and employees to the placement programmes.
• Track the outcomes of the placement programmes through reports and collection of success stories.
• Check programme milestones and disburse grants to companies.


Administration
• Assist in secretariat functions of ICT Academy
• Generate and prepares reports for updates and decision-making
• Coordinate all administrative matters for the ICT Academy
• Liaise with HR, Finance and other corporate services representatives
• Maintain and upkeep databases related to the Academy
• Compile and analyse statistics for submission to Government agencies


Requirements:
Academic & Professional Certification
• At least a good bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a reputable university
• IT savvy and proficient in MS Office and Adobe applications
• Knowledge of Power BI would be an added advantage


Experience & Attributes
• At least 3 years’ relevant work experience in providing office administration and secretariat support
• People-oriented with strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
• Meticulous, self-driven, able to work independently and as a team
• Able to multi-task and manage requests effectively



(EA Licence No. 14C7000)
(EA Personnel Registration No : R1110355)

The experience combined with their commitment to establish a deep understanding of our client and their business priorities enable CTES to deliver value far beyond the service provided by traditional search firms. We provide an impeccable match. At CTES, we believe in providing a seamless match between candidate and client. We deem it our responsibility to thoroughly understand our client's needs, and to obtain in-depth knowledge of the job requirements and the culture of the client's organization. This enables us to provide suitable and proficient candidates to our clients. By ensuring a close match between the candidate and position, we are able to foster a win-win situation, for both our clients and our candidates. CTES aims to be an organisation renowned throughout the Asia-Pacific region, integral to both employers and career seekers. We hope to become the preferred HR and career consultants for our clients and candidates respectively.
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Events / Promotions, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is actively searching for a Assistant Manager, Academy and Outreach to join their team!
If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

The responsibilities of this role are:

Outreach Activities
Initiate and conduct outreach activities, as well as manage both the relationship and implementation of organisations’ manpower re-deployment plans ; organisations include MNCs, Large Local Enterprises (LLEs), SMEs, members of Trade Associations & Chambers (TACs) and Unions.
Grow a strong network of organisations as key employers and industry partners.
Partnership
Collaborate with relevant partners and government agencies to actively promote career opportunities and help PMETs in identifying personal goals, re-skilling and career planning.
Collaborate with the various Institutions of Higher Learning, Training Providers and the Academic Units in providing suitable courses for the placement-oriented programmes, seeking government funding support and engaging in employer outreach activities, based on strategic priorities.
Publicity
Work with the Marketing team in creating marketing materials and tools to conduct outreach activities.
Market and generate awareness of University programmes and placement-oriented programmes to both organisations and individuals.
Assist to promote re-employment programmes (e.g. CCP, SCTP) to organisations such as MNCs, Large Local Enterprises (LLEs), SMEs, members of Trade Associations & Chambers (TACs) and Unions.
Administration
Assist in secretariat functions of the ICT Academy
Generate and prepare reports for updates and decision-making
Coordinate all administrative matters for the ICT Academy
Liaise with HR, Finance and other corporate services representatives
Maintain and upkeep databases related to the Academy
Compile and analyse statistics for submission to Government agencies
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:

Academic & Professional Certification
At least a good bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a reputable university
IT savvy and proficient in MS Office and Adobe applications
Knowledge of Power BI would be an added advantage
Experience & Attributes
At least 3 years’ relevant work experience in providing office administration and secretariat support
People-oriented with strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Meticulous, self-driven, able to work independently and as a team
Able to multi-task and manage requests effectively
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

All applicants' CV will be treated with the strictest confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

address: MARINA ONE EAST TOWER, 7 STRAITS VIEW 018936
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Summary
We believe that challenges are better solved together. That's why you'll join a diverse, global community of solvers - an unexpected mix of people that come together to build trust in society and solve important problems. With us, you are encouraged to lead with your heart and values, and where your unique skills are developed and put to work in unexpected and exciting ways, superpowered by technology.

We are Asia’s leading financial services practice and our firm is offering you an exceptional opportunity to work with both large scale and boutique reputable asset management clients in this sector. Our AWMS practice provides an invaluable safeguard in today’s complex operating environment with insights, empowered by leading technologies into marketplace developments and global opportunities. Our team is multi-disciplinary, made up of proven specialist professionals dedicated to this sector.

Our AWMS team is expanding rapidly and we are looking for a business support team administrator to join us and support in a few areas such as administrative and secretarial support, pipeline management, and day-to-day operational matters.

How will you value-add as a Business Support Team Administrator?
Provide effective administrative and secretarial support to our Deputy Heads
Liaise with clients and managing of diaries
Make travel arrangements for the business unit, schedule internal and external meetings
Coordinate events and relevant logistics where needed
Support engagement economics reporting and monitor follow-up actions by teams
Generate reports on sales pipelines and provide periodic update to the management team
Provide support to our engagement teams in the project engagement cycle from opportunity creation to closure of projects
Help engagement teams in maintaining/ updating engagement records
Support the on-boarding of new joiners, keep track of the learning & development courses and leave planning of the teams
Support document management including formatting, system upload of client deliverables etc
Provide onsite support for document management including printing, scanning, courier etc
Perform ad-hoc duties assigned and provide necessary cover for team members
About you
Minimum Diploma in Business
At least 2 years' working experience in an administrative role is preferred
Good positive attitude and adaptable to changes in processes and systems
Willingness to grow and take on new tasks/responsibilities
Independent and efficient worker that can follow through and complete tasks on tight deadlines
Strong communication skills to interact with engagement teams and other stakeholders
Good interpersonal skills and a team player
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple tasks and meet tight/stringent deadlines while maintaining accuracy
Well organised and detail-oriented
Proficient in Microsoft office suite and/or Google suite
Knowledge of the Salesforce, Oracle and ServiceNow would be an added advantage
*Only shortlisted candidates will be notified due to the high number of applicants for this role.

title: Accounting and administrative assistant
company_info: Godrej (Singapore) Pte Ltd was established in 1971. Currently Godrej (Singapore) Pte. Ltd has just completed 50 Years in business. The company has Associate / Related companies in India, Vietnam and Sultanate of Oman manufacturing steel office furniture, shelving systems, security equipment and custom-built steel fabrications. Our Parent Company, M/S Godrej & Boyce Mfg Co. Ltd, Mumbai, India has been established for over 124 years and deals in a variety of items notably steel office equipment, refrigerators, locks, security equipment, machine tool, forklifts, toiletries cosmetics, oleochemicals and agrovet products. We endevour to provide total furniture solutions (using materials like steel, wood and plastics) with suitable designs for contemporary / modern commercial offices, home offices, industrial establishments, factories and workshops. Our Office Seating consists of Mesh, Leather, Fabric and PVC upholstered chairs with comfortable and ergonomic designs which ensure good back and head support. Apart from being a trusted office/ workstation supplier in Singapore, we also provide training room furniture, pre-school and school furniture in a variety of colours and sizes. Partition systems/ work stations designed by us are ideally suited for offices, staff rooms and call centres and can be complemented with our wide variety of office seating products. Our customers in Singapore include the Government of Singapore (our largest customer), Statutory Bodies, Private companies and Individuals. Our Associate / Related companies export products to Singapore (distributed through our company), Australia, New Zealand,USA, Europe, Middle East, Fiji, Indonesia, Philippines Myanmar, Cambodia, Brunei, Papua New Guinea, Mauritius and African countries.

Provide administrative support to the accounting department.
Check the accuracy of invoices and other accounting documents or records.
Update and maintain accounting journals, ledgers and other records detailing financial business transactions (e.g., disbursements, expense vouchers, receipts, accounts payable). Enters data into computer system using defined computer programs (TALLY)
Compile data and prepare reports.
Recommends actions to resolve discrepancies.
Investigates questionable data.
Accounts and admin assistant Responsibilities:
Performing basic office tasks, responding to emails, processing mail, filing, etc.
Provide administrative support to the accounting department.
Maintaining a database, ensuring that records are complete and current.
Recording information, processing, and filing forms.
Assisting the Accountant in preparing checks, deposits, budgets, and financial reports.
Updating ledgers and resolving discrepancies.
Assisting the Accountant in maintaining bank deposits and check payment records.
Assisting the Accountant in reconciling bank records with bank statements.
Abiding by all company procedures and accounting principles.
Responding appropriately to vendor, client, and internal requests.
Qualifications/Requirements:
Certificate in Nitec/Diploma in Accounting or other relevant certificate
Minimum 2 years of relevant experience
Meticulous, Independent & organised
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Highly self-motivated, good working attitude with a high level of professionalism and integrity
Good team player and adaptable to a dynamic environment
Good communications & interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Able to start work within a short notice preferred
Manage / Assist daily administration and operational duties
Handling office tasks such as filing, data entry, document scanning, printing, and compiling
Generate monthly reports detailing accounts receivable status and end of period account closing activities, sending bill reminders & contacting customers on due invoices if any
Ensure that accounting reports and supporting documents follow regulations, standards and practices
Other Ad-hoc tasks and duties as assigned by the HOD.

title: Administration Assistant
company_info: Chong Sin International is the leading education service provider in Singapore providing pre-study advisory through to the landing services and all other academic and personalised services for our international students. Our Vision: To be the leading education service provider for overseas Chinese in Southeast Asia. Our Mission: Assist our students to fulfil their dreams of graduating from the best universities in the world, through our "heart work" and extensive coaching.
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, Education and Training, General Work, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role assists in the administration of the student placement department. You will work alongside with your colleagues to deliver and meet positive outcomes for our customers.

Key Responsibilities:
Working with sales colleagues, assist in the student application process to various schools in Singapore.
Prepare necessary documentation and apply for Student Pass with ICA, and follow through entire application process.
Liaise with parents, prepare documents and submit LTVP application to ICA.
Assist with other necessary processes required by the new incoming families.
Organise school visits for potential parents to introduce to them the school facilities and the school curriculum.
Responsible for the creation, maintenance, and updating of the students’ database and records.
Monitor vacancies and waiting lists at all grade levels.
Support excellent customer service and assistance to new and current families throughout all admissions processes.
Work collaboratively and communicate effectively with relevant colleagues.
Develop personal rapport with prospective parents and students.

Requirements:
Diploma education and above.
Fresh graduates are welcomed. Some working experience will be ideal.
Effectively bilingual in English and Chinese in order to liaise with multilingual speaking parents and students.
Excellent verbal communication, presentation, and persuasion skills in a 1:1 and group setting.
Results-oriented and driven by successful outcomes
Team player, meticulous and organised.
Working knowledge of Google Suite softwares.
Training and attractive compensation awaits the right candidate!

title: Administrative Assistant
company_info: Founded in 2013, Independent Reserve is one of Australia’s largest, oldest and most trusted crypto exchanges. Our Singapore office opened in January 2020, and in 2021, we were the first cryptocurrency exchange in Singapore to receive a PSA licence from MAS, ahead of 170 global competitors. We have now grown to serve over 250,000 customers from Australia, New Zealand, and Singapore, who trust Independent Reserve to easily buy, sell and hold Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP and other digital assets. Independent Reserve offers an OTC desk, merchant services, AutoTrader, API connectivity, world-class security and the KPMG Tax Report.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reporting to the CEO of the Singapore office, this is a diverse role and will require a motivated and hard-working team player to provide administrative support, conduct research, manage data and generally ensure the smooth running of the office.

This is a great opportunity for a professional who thrives on variety and is looking to develop their experience across a range of functions, including Compliance, Sales, Marketing and HR.

The ideal candidate will have the ability to learn quickly and demonstrate a willingness to undertake any task at hand. The right attitude and initiative are valued over years of experience, so entry-level candidates are encouraged.

Some of the key responsibilities include:

Performing detailed research, gathering data and accurately updating regulatory records.
Managing large volumes of data efficiently and accurately.
Creating and updating records and databases.
Performing general office duties such as liaising with suppliers, document management, organising quotes, ordering and maintaining office supplies and equipment etc.
Organising meetings, travel etc. and assisting with events and conferences.
Supporting the general administrative needs of the team.
Carrying out other ad hoc duties as required.

Skills and experience we are looking for:

1-2 years of office support experience is preferred but not essential.
Business-level Mandarin; Essential for this role.
Solid Google Docs and MS Office skills, particularly Excel.
A systematic and organized working style.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to multi-task, prioritise and manage time effectively.
Initiative, with the confidence to ask questions or for advice when necessary.
Ability to deal with stakeholders at all levels.
A positive and proactive approach to tasks.

What we offer:

A competitive salary.
A challenging and rewarding role in the dynamic crypto industry.
A winning, fun, hard-working team.
An international work environment where your opinion counts.
Ongoing learning and support.
Great career development opportunities in a growing company.

title: ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
company_info: TADCASTER PUBS PTE. LTD. Incorporated in June 2009 Tadcaster Pubs Pte. Ltd is the holding company for the management, development and acquisition of bars, pubs and food concepts that cater mainly to the expatriate and internationally aware local audience in Singapore. Our short-medium term goals are to solidify our current operations whilst developing new brands within this sector. Our long-term goals are outward looking towards regional expansion. In October 2009 we acquired three new businesses, Celtic Mead Pte Ltd (bq bar & Dharma’s Kebab’s), Inisfree Pte Ltd (Molly Malone’s Irish Pub and Brasserie) and merged HosconAsia Pte Ltd, a pub and bar based consultancy company into the group. The purchasing of these three companies is both a strategic and financial investment for the future of the group. Since then, we acquired Cafe Melba Pte Ltd, The Exchange Asia Square Pte Ltd and Cafe Melba Too Pte Ltd. While we understand the dangers of fast growth, we have always ensured that processes, systems and policies are in place to guarantee that information is recorded, reported and used in a wise manner; we must be vigilant for new opportunities that will present themselves in the near and distant future.
